campaign.story:
BloomingTables is an elegant functional living table that seamlessly brings the beauty of the outdoors - indoors. 
Planters haven’t changed in centuries, leaving us with a handful of typical options to house our plants.   
BloomingTables is the most beautiful and easy way to seamlessly integrate plants into our lives - all while saving space. 
How it works: 
This acrylic tub keeps everything watertight, protecting both your BloomingTable, and your floors from water. 
Fill your BloomingTable with a layer of gravel and activated charcoal to absorb water and protect against over watering. 
Then simply create your own beautiful arrangement. 
When it’s time to water, simply lift the glass off our suction cups, water, and replace. 
Place your BloomingTable under a windowsill.
Or place a lamp on or near the table with incandescent light-bulbs to supplement sunlight.
Benefits:
How its Made: 
30 inches tall
33 inches long
10.5 inches wide 
6mm Tempered Glass
UV resistant suction cups 
Waterproofing Acrylic Tub
Painted Maple Veneer box
Painted Steal Hairpin Legs 
About Us:
We are so excited to share our love of plants with others through BloomingTables. While this is our first Kickstarter campaign, we have an amazing team behind us to ensure the success of this campaign from conception to fulfillment. We are proud to have partnered with an industry leader, Aqua Design Innovations (ADI), who have launched over 8 successful Kickstarters! ADI shares our values of quality and innovation, and this collaboration has resulted in a promising campaign that seeks to bring joy and beauty to countless homes and offices. 
As plant lovers, it wasn’t long before we were running out of places to keep our plants. We wanted to find a way to bring more plants into our lives in a new and innovative way. There are an abundance of stunning species of plants, and countless ways to create arrangements. However, there are limited options for the housing of indoor plants. BloomingTables was born out of the idea that beautiful plants deserve beautiful homes. We have created a product that has brought character and joy into our home, and we want to share this experience with others. 
BloomingTables was not created overnight. We have gone through 3 rounds of prototyping, dozens of tweaks, and assured that we selected a trusted manufacturer that would bring the highest level of quality. We are excited to finally be able to bring this product to you. Thank you for your support in our mission to beautify homes and offices everywhere – one BloomingTable at a time. 
Timeline:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once our campaign is completed and funded, we are ready to go place our order with our manufacturer. We have selected a reputable manufacturer that is standing-by for our completed campaign. Although we are confident in our manufacturing partner, with any product, delays can happen. We are committed to maintaining full transparency with members of the BloomingTable community, and we will inform our backers immediately if any delays with delivery arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The blue wavelengths we experience naturally during daylight hours are responsible for keeping us alert. However, these wavelengths that enable our attention, our reaction times, and our moods during the day have also made their way into electronic devices we use at all hours, day and night. 
With the popularity and growing usage of smartphones, tablets, and computers, as well as energy-efficient lighting, we have dramatically increased our exposure to blue light. Since the long-term effects of these new technologies are not yet clear, we wanted to produce a stylish solution that still allows users to access their screens, while also reducing the amount of blue light they see on a daily basis, especially at night.    
Did you know?
The average American is online at least 24 hours each week.
85% of Americans check their smartphones within an hour of waking up and going to bed.
Many jobs require you to stare at a computer for hours, but when you get home, you're ready to relax with a screen of your choice. Whether you want to stream your favorite show, play video games, or check social media on your mobile devices

campaign.story:
With the release of new magical mobile games, there will be more witches and wizards than ever before roaming the streets looking for power outlets. And, since traditional wands aren't compatible with smartphones, reach for The CELLder Wand – the perfect digital accessory for the modern witch or wizard.
Complete your wizarding look with an accessory that is both functional and fashionable (at least to fellow witches and wizards). The faux-moke carrying pouch protects your CELLder Wand from dings and scratches… and potential thieves. Wear it around your neck to keep the contents extra secure or simply keep it in your bag or pocket.
GGTR was born on Kickstarter. We owe everything to our OG Kickstarter backers for supporting us from day one and being patient with us while we grew from a team of two into the team of 10+ passionate technology Witches and Wizards that we are now, with a track record for delivering great products to gamers. Since Chargemander, we've launched several projects for gamers and tech enthusiasts. Check them out below,
                                       Even in developing countries, smartphones are ubiquitous. What is less accessible, however, is power. We believe that access to the internet can provide new opportunities to people everywhere. We will develop/support solar charging options in locations that need it most, beginning with Africa.
We proudly donate 5% of our annual profit to SolarAid. The not-for-profit organization helps to provide access to solar lights in Uganda, Malawi, and Zambia to help catalyze solar markets and eradicate the kerosene lamp. help provide access to solar lights in Uganda, Malawi, and Zambia to help catalyze solar markets and eradicate the kerosene lamp.
We spent many hours sketching out our product ideas for The CELLder Wand. Sticking to our mission statement – we wanted to find a fun solution to charging for those with an affinity for witchcraft and wizardry. We always wanted our charger to be multi-functional and engineered for gaming on the go. Seen the concept development for the wand below,
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We understand the risks of development and production better than most. Bringing a product from an idea to reality takes tons of hard work and perseverance (and a great team). We've learned a lot since launching our first product and are confident that we will deliver a great product on time.

There will be challenges and unexpected hurdles along the way. There always are. We've built in plenty of time to test everything at every step of the way, as we've learned the hard way that there is no such thing as too much testing, and we will make sure that the end product we deliver to our backers is a great one.

In the unlikely event that we encounter an obstacle that does delay our shipping timeline, we promise to communicate with you every step of the way.

If you fund it, we will deliver it on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Greetings Witches and Wizards.... 
On the eve of the global release of Wizards Unite, we have some very good news... 
WE ARE READY TO SHIP!

Greetings fellow Witches and Wizards!
Happy Halloween! We know you’ve been patiently waiting for an update.. So here we go!
As we mentioned in our last update, we did experience some delays due to the increase of battery size of The CELLder Wand – going from 3,000mAh to 5,000mAh required us to do a little more work on our end. But, at the end of the day, this really is for the best. Because once Niantic releases their next Wizarding game – you’re going to need all the battery power you can get.

campaign.story:
Made in the USA from high-quality hemp and recycled fiber fleece, this cozy, cowl-neck sweater can be zipped up over your head to say "Leave Me Alone".
Whether you're being badgered by your family or coworkers, with someone who just can't take a hint, or trying to sleep in the airport, the Leave Me Alone Sweater has you covered. Invented by Ruth Grace Wong, the Leave Me Alone Sweater went viral, and now we need to put together an order of 300 sweaters to be able to have them manufactured.
Features
Made from 55% hemp and 45% recycled fiber fleece, each charcoal-colored, cowl-neck Leave Me Alone Sweater features cozy thumbholes, side seam pockets, and a high-quality, California-made zipper.
We've been working hard sourcing the perfect fabric, perfecting the pattern and fit, and visiting local factories. We came up with a fantastically comfy sweater made to last many years, and our entire supply chain is something we can be proud of.
Playful | Sustainable | Manufactured Locally | High Quality
Sizing Chart
Follow us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Understanding manufacturing means being empowered to support jobs within my local community and to create something new and share it with the world. I hope to be able to use my success to do just that. This will be my first experience doing sourcing and working with factories, and I've been preparing by taking garment industry classes (http://garmentindustry411.com/) and attending a production sewing boot camp (http://abqfashionincubator.com/wp/).

Here are what I think the biggest risks are, and how we are addressing them:

Running out of money
We've costed the fabric and the cutting and sewing for the sweater, and left in wiggle room for other expenses like shipping the fabric, care labels, packaging, and fulfillment. If everything goes perfectly we will be able to invest 40% of the money from Kickstarter into making extra sweaters, but if something goes wrong or costs more than expected, we will have money to fix the issue and maintain our high quality standards.

Not being able to fulfill on time
If our fabric supplier does not have enough fabric in stock in their warehouse, the lead time to have fabric manufactured is 8 weeks. For cutting and sewing the sweaters, it takes about 6 weeks. Plus it will take extra time for shipping the parts to their destinations, and packaging and shipping the completed sweaters to backers. Based on these numbers we think we will be able to ship in October, but if we run into unexpected problems, we can be up to 2 months late and still ship by Christmas.

Poor quality
As the amount of American garment manufacturing decreases, the availability of highly skilled workers also goes down. The sweater is designed with a simple construction so that it can be sewn consistently well by any factory. I have also taken steps to educate myself by taking courses and attending a production sewing bootcamp, with the intention of visiting the factory regularly during production to catch and remediate any manufacturing issues early on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Ruth Grace Wong
First created · 11 backed
manufacturing engineerSee more

updates.update_userinfo: Nothing's ever perfect the first time!
updates.update_content: We're on the second draft of the pattern for the sweater now. We've made the cuffs ¾ inches wider, so that you can pull your sleeves up your arm without them sliding back to your wrists when you're washing your hands. Kathleen also helped me make the shoulder part fit better. After wearing Version 1 for a week, I was finding that the shoulder seams were slipping down my shoulder, and I asked Kathleen if the sweater was too big for me. Kathleen explained that the armholes were likely too small, which made them want to slide down my arm. She also adjusted the slope of the shoulder and size of the armhole. I've been wearing Version 2 for a week and the shoulder sizing problem seems to be fixed. If the Kickstarter is funded we'll probably go through a few more revisions before we finalize things for production.

I've partnered with my friend Victoria, who's been doing a bang-up job reaching out to press and writing some seriously gut-busting content. Here's the latest!
https://www.boredpanda.com/ruth-grace-wongs-sweater-made-her-an-internet-sensation-when-all-she-wanted-was-to-be-left-alone/
https://www.buzzfeed.com/victoriadobbs/15-gifts-for-moms-who-desperately-need-a-day-off-3dwgf

comments.content: Nephew... He much demonstrates this.
Go Ruth!!!

campaign.story:
日本語でのプロジェクト説明はこちら！
※日本語版キャンペーンページが公開されてから「リワード」、「開発者紹介」などの情報が変更されています。最新の情報については、アップデート、英語版キャンペーンページをご覧ください。
The Good Life is a debt repayment daily life RPG co-developed by SWERY's White Owls Inc. and a development team led by Yukio Futatsugi, the creator of Panzer Dragoon and Phantom Dust.
The Good Life is a Daily Life Simulator x SWERISM  
You like bizarre and mysterious things?
You like unique and memorable characters?
You want to enjoy a game that offers a lot of freedom, but you also want to enjoy a good story?
Think that's too much to ask for? Not in The Good Life! This game is made for you!
Play as Naomi, a journalist from New York who moves to a backwoods British town called Rainy Woods in order to pay off her massive debt.
The only way for her to escape from debt hell is to take pictures of happenings in the town and report on them. Of course, 'the happiest town in the world' is not your average town...  
The inhabitants of the happiest town in the world are some of the most bizarre people you'll ever come across. You'll live alongside them as you solve mysteries and experience a hearty helping of craziness. We're sure that you'll eventually come to love all the mystery, horror, and good old charm that this town has to offer.

Download from the link below

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wkbB1bNsht-EVkiyvfxdYumbZGIwmuTW/view?usp=sharing

The Good Life Prototype Demo, Available Now!
Read Update 24 for all the instructions
The main character of this game is a female New Yorker named Naomi. In order to pay off her debt, she took a job from a newspaper company in NY and moved to the 'happiest town in the world.' This game chronicles all the bizarre things she experiences during her time in the town.
 A completely new 'daily life action-adventure game' with a slow life that isn't actually slow!
 In this game, the player has two main goals: 
1. Pay off your debt with money you earn from doing photography jobs in the town.

2. Solve the mystery of the murder that took place in the 'happiest town in the world.'
The townspeople are also hiding a big secret...
 In the moonlight, all the townspeople suddenly transform... And suddenly, the town is filled with cats and dogs!
Once a month, everyone who lives there transforms into either a cat or a dog.
Naturally, Naomi and the player will also turn into a cat or a dog.
You'll be able to select whether you want to transform into a cat or a dog at the very beginning. But if you get far enough in the story, you may reach a point where you can freely switch between them...?
What happens in the town depends entirely on you!
How the townspeople behave, how their lives play out, and how the story ends... It'll all change based on your decisions.
(How you interact with the townspeople and make friends with them will change how they think and behave.)
The townspeople's relationships will change based on how you play. In one town, you may see a surprising couple start dating... Or a normal character in your town may become the mayor of your friend's town...
You may even be able to influence how the story in your town plays out!
The story will eventually lead its main character (you) to a shocking truth...
As a journalist, your job is to take photographs as you live out your life in the town.
You can take photos of anyone, anywhere, then later post those photos on a photo app or sell them to a newspaper company for money.
All you need to do is frame your subjects! The abilities of your equipment will determine the overall quality.
This means that in order to take good pictures, you'll need to acquire a lot of different tools!
But first, you'll need to make a lot of money...  
In order to pay off your debt, in order to buy good equipment, in order to enjoy yourself, in order to quench your thirst for fashion...
In order to enjoy your life in Rainy Woods to the fullest, you'll need to take every chance you can to earn some extra cash!
Make money with your photos!
 There are two ways for you to turn your photographs into money.
The first is to use the in-game SNS photo app "Flamingo."
Unlike Instagram, you can earn advertising profits for each "Like" your photos get.
All you need to do is upload them!
Choose photos that best capture the seasons, add fun filters to your animal shots, or create a charming portrait.
Choose photos that you think will get the most buzz on Flamingo and rack up the Likes!
The other way is to sell your photos to Morningvale, a newspaper company.
Photographs connected to the town's secrets will yield great rewards. What are the townspeople hiding...?
Since Naomi's debt is connected to Morningvale, all the money you earn through them will only be used to pay it off.
Make even more money with various part-time jobs!
 What do you think of when you hear the word 'countryside?' Gathering bugs and fruit? No, we're tired of all that! Shear sheep, deliver milk, make jam and hay, do some gardening, or work as a bartender, a casino dealer, a miner, or even mine for cryptocurrency if you want to! Enjoy some part-time jobs that are really 'out there' and give your country life a little mature flavor!
Blow all the money you've earned on whatever you want!
 You can use the money you earn to pay off your debt and buy new camera equipment, but sometimes, it's good just to blow it on something fun!
Go out for a drink, buy an expensive brand item, enjoy some afternoon tea, start an antique furniture collection...
Don't forget to reward yourself for working hard!
Enjoy the changes in time and season!
This is an open-world game centered around a rural English town. Naturally, the time and seasons will run on their own in-game clock. There will be special photos that you can only take in certain seasons which can be sold for lots of money, and we want traditional English events to appear in their proper seasons. Of course, classic events such as Halloween, Christmas, Valentine's Day, and Easter are also being considered! Aside from events, you can test your luck in other ways such as journeying into mines to discover valuable ore veins, fishing your heart out, or harvesting a field of crops.
Enjoy fashion!
 You can use money to give Naomi some style! Try on different outfits and pick the look you like best. Some clothes might even boost Naomi's parameters...
You need to take good care of yourself!
This game contains various parameters. For example, life, stamina, hunger, sleepiness, inebriation, beauty care... And for Naomi, a native to one of the world's most cutting edge cities, beauty care is super important!
Make sure you don't forget to give yourself some special care every morning and every evening. Otherwise, you'll lose your feminine charm and end up as a filthy flytrap!
Once per month, you can enjoy the limitless freedom that only cats and dogs get to experience.
Turn into a cat and climb up to high places, scratch walls, and steal fish and chips from kitchens... Or turn into a dog and dig holes, follow scents, and swim in rivers and lakes... It only happens once a month, so make sure you enjoy it to your heart's content!
Cat/dog mystery solving image
Use your telescope lens to snap shots of targets in areas you can reach as a cat, or get up close to them as a dog and try to acquire the perfect scoop for a scandal photograph. There are some mysteries that only animals can solve! When you turn into one, you'll be able to do new things and adventure into new places.
From the very beginning, we have been very careful about focusing on the one goal that really matters, and that’s getting the campaign funded.
We had made plans for Stretch Goals, though. We put together two plans, one in case the campaign was incredibly successful very fast, and another plan in case the campaign got funded a few weeks in. We also knew there was a chance the campaign would only get funded at the last minute, which ended up the case. We didn’t talk about the other alternative, because we believe in the campaign.
Anyhow, we want to address Stretch Goals in case we do get funded and you want to know what the extra funds will go towards.
We had a long meeting today about this, and we kept coming back to the one thing that we have been asked the most throughout the campaign: bringing The Good Life to the Nintendo Switch.

Even though, as you know, our lead programmer has started to play with the console devkit, we know that this will be a costly endeavour and we don’t want to mess up our budget.

We have set a unique Stretch Goal at JPY 88,000,000 - bringing The Good Life to the Nintendo Switch

Of course, we know this is a very high Stretch Goal, and considering the way the campaign is going, it is very much possible we are not going to reach it, so let me explain our reasoning.
We could have set up more stretch goals, adding content to the game, and help them build up towards the Switch Stretch Goal. However, as each of this smaller goal comes with a cost, they would have set the Switch Stretch Goal even further, making it meaningless, and upsetting the numerous fans who have been asking for the Switch port.
We could have set up those smaller game content stretch goals, and not mention the Switch Stretch Goal, but as I mentioned, this is by far the number one request I have received during the campaign, and not addressing it seems bad.

So, we decided to aim high - go for one single ambitious stretch goal, the most requested addition to the campaign.

BUT.

If we do get funded and we miss the Stretch Goal, we will use the extra funds towards additional content for the game and we will share what these are with you in a post campaign update. To give you an idea, we are considering things like adding more music tracks, adding more seasonal events to Rainy Woods, creating more part time jobs/revenue generating activities for Naomi to repay her crippling debt, more outfits for our intrepid photographer, and so on.
This way you know that whatever happens, you are building towards a better game.

What happens to the Nintendo Switch version if we miss the Stretch Goal?
We really, really want to make a Switch version. Any game developer these days is excited about this console. I would love to see fans playing The Good Life on the go, on the train. However, I also want to make The Good Life, and for this, we need to be very careful with our budget, and have a clear focus.
If we miss the Stretch Goal, I will work very hard to find an alternative way to get the Nintendo Switch version to happen, but we are not making it a promise to you. And the moment we know we can make it, you will be the first to be informed.

What about collecting funds after the campaign to go toward the Switch Stretch Goal?

We discussed this, and as you will see in the next part of the update, we are planning for a way to collect some extra funds after the campaign. However, I know other Kickstarter campaigns have run late backers campaigns in a way where they have set those extra funds to complete more Stretch Goals.
I think this is admirable and brave, but for The Good Life, we want to be able to really focus on our initial game, and work really hard towards it as soon as possible. The idea of having Stretch Goals indefinitely opened after the end of the campaign is quite scary, it gives us a moving target, harder to hit.
For this reason, we are only looking at the funds gathered during the campaign for the Stretch Goals. I believe it will lead to a better focus on our part, and a better game in the end for you all, and I hope you can support that decision and that philosophy.
 “DEADLY PREMONITION DEVELOPER ANNOUNCES NEW GAME, THE GOOD LIFE ”
- IGN  
 “Deadly Premonition creator’s next game is a cat RPG”
- Polygon  
 “Deadly Premonition director Swery announces RPG about people who turn into cats”
- Eurogamer
Shipping Information
In order to keep costs as fair as possible and to avoid those costs to count towards our goals, we are planning to use a pledge manager (like BackerKit) to handle the shipping costs. Shipping costs will reflect the actual cost to ship your pledge. They will be charged to you when the items are ready to be sent, after the game has launched.
BackerKit confirmed for our pledge manager
We are very happy to be able to confirm that we will use BackerKit to manage the pledges after the campaign. If you are not familiar with BackerKit, they are a company specialised in supporting the logistical side of crowdfunding campaigns.
It will allow us to more efficiently manage the surveys, and make sure we collect the right amount for the shipping costs if you have a physical reward that needs to be sent to you.
Now, BackerKit also allows us to do a few extra things that are interesting. We can run a late backers campaign with them - we are still figuring things out about this and we might do one. But more importantly, we do know that we will allow our Kickstarter backers to purchase additional items from the campaign. In order for you to be able to plan which tier is best to pledge for, we want to let you know now about items that we have confirmed will be accessible to our backers on BackerKit, and their prices.
Please note that the listed prices (just like the campaign rewards) do not include the shipping costs:
・The Good Life T-Shirt. $40
・The Good Life Hoodie. $95
・The Good Life Mug. $20
・Digital Copy of the game on PC. $30
・Digital Copy of the game on PS4. $40
We haven’t confirmed the other items - especially the Collector’s Edition box. The current CE box has an exclusive design for the Kickstarter campaign, but we know that there will be a Limited Run version available at some point as well, and it might mean we won’t offer the Kickstarter exclusive box on BackerKit.
If you have already backed The Good Life and put money beyond the reward tier that you have selected, please note that you will be able to use those extra funds towards these extra items.
And if you already know you want one those items, of course, you can increase your pledge accordingly, just make sure you stay at the reward tier that you want. For instance, if you want the Joyful Life Tier (about $50), but are interested in getting the T-Shirt, you can pledge $90, and keep your pledge at the Joyful Life Tier.
The Good Life - Physical Collector's Edition
Here are the contents of the Physical Collector's Edition.
It's going to be filled with a lot of high quality items produced by Limited Run, a company known for its great work on countless physical editions so far! Here is a list of everything that will be a part of the set!
The Good Life Physical Collector's Edition Contents:
- Kickstarter Exclusive Box (Embossed, with a completely unique design)
- Physical Game Disc (your choice of a PS4 or a PC version; PC version comes with a Steam key)
- Post Card (Scenery of Rainy Woods)
- Post Card (Letter from Team With SWERY's & Mr. Futatsugi's Signatures)
- Rainy Woods Tourist Guide Leaflet (A4 size, tri-fold)
- Artbook (A bit smaller than A5)
- Trading Cards (Characters / Dogs / Cats)
- Soundtrack CD

Rewards description and USD prices
Below you can find a summary of all the rewards, along an estimate of their price in US Dollars. The campaign is in Japanese Yen, those prices below are purely a guideline for the price range. As currency exchange rates can vary, we recommend you check on a dedicated website to have an up-to-date price of the rewards.
 I'm SWERY, the director of The Good Life.
The Good Life is my "dream game". I've been thinking about it for a very long time, and was finally blessed with a chance to develop it thanks to my powerful partners - and you, of course. Please join in on our project and help us make my dream game into EVERYONE'S dream game! I Love You All!
 I'm Futatsugi, from G-rounding. A long time ago, I used to believe that games had magic in them. A new game always brought me a brand new experience, and excitement as to what would happen next. Crazy things would happen, and it felt really like I had fallen under some sort of spell. But lately, the risks involved in creating new games have gotten more and more extreme, and it's becoming harder and harder to make magic games. SWERY and I want to bring that magic back - but we need to borrow a little mana from you in order to summon it. We want to show the world a kind of magic it's never seen.
 I'm Hotta, the art director. When I first heard about The Good Life, I was deeply drawn in by atmosphere (a personal favorite style of mine) and the direction its art style was heading in. I'm so excited to start working on it. After working hard on the art direction, we've finally arrived at the style that I always hoped we would eventually reach! I'm going to put 120% of all I've got into this, while enjoying the chemical reactions that ensue between the art style, the atmosphere, and SWERY!
I first met Swery in 2013, I think. We immediately hit it off, and always met up whenever I went to Japan and whenever he came to America. We quickly became good enough friends to have long, deep talks about the future together. When he released the amazing D4, we collaborated with him and performed the soundtrack live, but this time with The Good Life, we've received the chance to work with him on an even deeper level - actually creating the music itself. Orchestral music, band rock, and excellent singing are all important elements of the VGO, so we intend to supply you all with some Sweryism music that only we can create. We'll be posting some demos later, so please check them out!
Unity
White Owls has an idea for a fun game. G-rounding has the skill and the experience to create it. However, we don't possess the funds to push this project forward.
Since 2010, the methods by which games are created have been changing rapidly. Through the proliferation of various game engines, virtually anyone can make their own game now as long as they set up the proper environment for it. Indie games have risen, multiple digital distribution platforms have become well-established, and new platforms such as VR have entered the fray. Due to these reasons and more, we game creators must adapt to many changes in order to survive. 
This is especially true when it comes to gathering funds. The method to gather funds known as crowdfunding is now available to us. We no longer have to narrow in on our target and pitch an idea to a single investor in the hopes of possibly receiving a large amount of funds. Instead, it's becoming more and more common for game creators to pitch their ideas directly to their audience and gather funds that way.
The truth is that even in this day and age, most Japanese game creators still gather funds using the traditional method. But this method will never allow a creator to truly own their work and let it be their identity while also knowing that it will be able to support them their future -- two things that Western creators adopting newer methods have managed to achieve. In Japan, copyrights always belong to the investors, which includes not only the profits from those rights, but also the rights to create continuations using the same IPs.
That's why we want to take the awesome concept behind The Good Life and use our skill to build it on equal footing with our investors. After thinking long and hard about what our best course of action would be, we decided to adopt a hybrid model that allows us to push forth the project with both funds from partners and crowdfunding together.
Our plan is to gather a portion of the necessary funds for our project from this campaign. Currently, we're already negotiating with several partners about this project, and we hope that successfully completing this campaign will bring The Good Life closer to perfection in the end.
Many game creators narrow in on their target, alter their project scope and change their game ideas in order to gain a large amount of funds from a single investor. But what if all those game creators could take their awesome ideas as-is and simply propose them straight to their players?
Crowdfunding makes this possible.We think The Good Life is an amazing idea, and will lead to a game that will be wholeheartedly accepted once it's completed. We want to prove this, with help from our supporters.
*We created a pie chart that exhibits the funding ratio between crowdfunding and partners.
UNTIES
 Limited Run
 Video Game Orchestra
MEGA64 
We may add more allies in the future, so keep your eyes peeled in the updates!
Last Autumn, we learned a lot thanks to our first campaign. We feel our biggest shortcoming was our inability to provide to our supporters a solid guarantee that we would complete the game no matter what.
Therefore, we decided to reboot our project only after finding a powerful partner and getting proper guarantees in order to ensure that we would be able to deliver The Good Life to you all.
By teaming up with UNTIES, the new indie game label from Sony Music Entertainment, we will now be able to plan everything from the very beginning. The schedule up to the delivery of the product, localization, quality control, and making sure everyone around the world gets to join in.
We believe that this partnership guarantees that The Good Life project will reach completion.
While The Good Life now has strong partners associated with it, the project still has a long way to go and has to prove itself in many ways.
In the same manner, White Owls is a young company, even though I, SWERY, have been making games for a while. The crowdfunding campaign is a good way for us to start relationships with our partners on a strong foot, where they feel confident that the game will be great, and my team and I have a strong understanding of what will make the game amazing for our fans.
G-rounding has the history and more than enough power to develop the game, and partners have the marketing networks and the funds to release our game on a worldwide scale, but White Owls only has SWERY and the original idea for the project.
That's why I (SWERY) want to invite all our supporters to help us show the world the value of White Owls and The Good Life. If we can gather a part of the funds through crowdfunding and prove that White Owls and The Good Life has a strong appeal, we feel we will truly be able to push this project forward with far more power than we'd otherwise have on our own.
In other words, in order to create the best project centered around SWERY, we need much more than funds from a partner - we need to gather support (financial but also moral) through a crowdfunding campaign as well.
"But White Owls has SWERY. Isn't that enough?" To all my fans and supporters out there who may be thinking something like this, I'm truly grateful. But the hard truth is that those feelings alone are not enough to create an entire game. We want to prove that White Owls is a development studio worth supporting, so please, lend us your help!
We want all our supporters to join this project from the very beginning so that everyone can carry an equal voice and equal responsibility. Let's work together to build The Good Life into the best game it can possibly be!!
I Love You All!!  
SWERY 
 SWERY/WhiteOwls.inc                                     Twitter - Facebook - Instagrm - Webpage
G-rounding.inc                                                                        Twitter - Facebook - Webpage
Copyright © 2018 White Owls Inc. All rights reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
▼High volume
Since this game is based around a rural town in England, we’re going to need to make different environments and build events into them. With games like The Good Life, the fun factor is proportionate to the number of different events, so we need to try and put in as many events as we can and also create a variety of areas for them to happen in. This will cost us, and depending on how things go, we may not be able to include all the events we want to.

[Solution]
We’ve decided to create multiple plans for the game volume based on how much funding we end up getting. With the lowest volume plan, players will still be able to enjoy a mysterious story, take pictures and earn money, communicate with villagers, and enjoy life in a rural town. On top of that, we’ll also create a schedule for building peripheral elements such as decorations so that the game development will never come to a standstill due to monetary problems. Our staff members have been in the game industry for over 20 years, so we know how to strictly control our schedules.

▼Controlling a large number of characters is difficult
In this game, we’ll turn characters’ desires, habits, goals, preferences, and invitations to one another into parameters for an autonomous system that controls their actions within the game. This is the first time we’ve tried something like this, but if we manage to complete it, we’ll be able to freely add a ton of variety to the game. The risk is that we won’t know whether or not we can really pull this off until we give it a try.

[Solution]
In the end, if we can’t figure out a way to pull it off, we’ll control the NPCs using the same method we used in Deadly Premonition. We can create an enhanced version of that system, which has already been successful once, in order to greatly lower our risk of failure.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New partner announcement! / 新しいパートナーの発表！
The Good Life Development News April 2021/The Good Life 開発状況　2021年4月
updates.update_content:
The Good Life Development News April 2021
Ready for a little cooking? Because that's what we're going to explore in this month's update! Although it may come as a surprise, Naomi is quite the chef, and can cook and eat her own meals in-game. You'll be able to learn all sorts of recipes in game, although you will be required to track down the necessary ingredients!

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News March 2021/The Good Life 開発状況　2021年3月
updates.update_content:
Title: The Good Life Development News March 2021
This month, we'd like to introduce to you a bunch of the different locations you'll get to visit in The Good Life. Beautiful plains and lakes, mystical ruins and strange buildings... The Good Life is full of amazing locales! Also, if you compare this footage with footage from previous updates, you should be able to notice that we've added much more wildlife to the game, allowing you to enjoy Mother Nature even more!

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News February 2021 - The Good Life 開発状況　2021年02月
updates.update_content:
The Good Life Development News February 2021
-Team CAT and DOG Reactions  
Our world is filled with cat and dog lovers. And of course, there are also some who love both equally! In The Good Life, the townspeople of Rainy Woods will give Naomi different reactions when she's a cat or dog based on what team they're on! Check the video for more info!

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News January 2021 / The Good Life 開発状況　2021年1月
updates.update_content:
The Good Life Development News January 2021
Raising Sheep
We think the sheep mechanics in The Good Life are turning out pretty well, so this month's update will be a sheep-centric one.

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News December 2020 / The Good Life 開発状況　2020年12月
updates.update_content: The Good Life Development News - Dec. 2020

updates.update_userinfo: Important: The Good Life now has an official publisher! - 重要報告：The Good Lifeのパブリッシャーが正式に決定いたしました！
updates.update_content:
Important: The Good Life now has an official publisher!
Hello everyone. This is SWERY, the director of the game.
Sorry to keep you all waiting for so long!! Today, I am proud to announce that THE IRREGULAR CORPORATION, located in London, England, will be the publisher for the digital version of The Good Life.

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News October 2020/The Good Life 開発状況　2020年10月
updates.update_content:
Recent News

Hello backers! I'm SWERY, the director of The Good Life.
I pray from the bottom of my heart that everyone is living safely during these dangerous times.

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News - Sept. 2020 / The Good Life　開発状況　2020年9月
updates.update_content:
The Good Life Development News - Sept. 2020 
Dog Ability 🐶
 As a dog, you will have the ability to memorize various scents. The green cloud that you see near the characters' legs in the image below represents their scent, which you can memorize. As a dog, you'll be able to follow their scent trails in order to track them down. They each move around on their own unique daily schedules, so this will be a very convenient tool for you to use on your adventures. You may even be able to use this ability to find items that people have lost.

updates.update_userinfo: The Good Life Development News - August 2020 / The Good Life　開発状況　2020年8月
updates.update_content:
The Good Life Development News August 2020
Sheep Types
This month, we're going to introduce the different types of sheep that can be found in the game. First off, the sheep will have different colours of fur. The sheep you see below has brown and grey fur. You'll find other colours as well, so you can choose which colour of sheep you'd like to ride.

comments.content: Is this still looking viable for an Autumn release?
Would it be possible to change from PC version to PS4 since a PC version no longer is relevant for me?
is there an option for a refund? i have concerns with a lot of the content of swery's recent work, and i would much rather have the ability to opt out and purchase later if it isn't harmful.
I have the same question as Ariel Dean

if you see this, you may want to send a direct message to White Owls if they haven't gotten back to you yet; I find creators on KS are more likely to notice those when this far past the initial campaign

Question for the dev team, I backed the project to have my name in the credits but I am a trans non-binary person who has recently changed their name from when I initially backed this game. Is there any way I can let the devs know of my new name so I can be properly credited in the endgame credits? Any help is appreciated. Thank you.
My new name is Ariel Dean
If it helps, I am backer #13,056 and I previously went by the name "Heather Dean"

@Ariel Dean - if you see this, you may want to send a direct message to White Owls if they haven't gotten back to you yet; I find creators on KS are more likely to notice those when this far past the initial campaign

new locations video is nice, but if that is the player movement speed that feels a bit too low, definitely consider allowing her to walk faster, or adding a run function if one doesn't already exist, those little baby steps would drive me crazy.

Last comment regarding this has been three weeks ago, but any information about the surveys to pick the platform? I backed it early bird for PS4, but I don't have the console anymore, would love to get it for Steam or Xbox.
Any chance in the upcoming survery we're able to choose between PS4 and Xbox One?
Came here to ask this too. I backed the early bird for PS4 but I would much rather have it on Xbox now that it will be launching there as well.
Can't wait to play your game when it's finished!
When will the surveys come out?
Work hard, White Owls! I believe in you! Take my words and use them as wind at your backs!
Hi, Please can you explain the process to claim a refund on this project ?
I hope you’ll at least let me have a free key “when” TGF hits VCS for making this request and hopefully helping you sell TGL to more people! 😬😉
The game is looking good Swery! I can’t wait to explore the quaint little town you and your team is creating.
Very disappointing, leaving a very bad impression on the professionality (incl. planning + communication skills) here - compared to other backed projects!
Just popping in to say keep up the good work! I'd rather see a great game than a rushed game. I've loved watching the game progress through the updates and I can't wait for the final version.
I hope at some point something happens, but updates(haha a new email) every six months, with no gameplay/beta/alpha anything apart from music and some screenshots, does not make me happy
When are we going to be able to download this game?!
@Victoria Lewis, whenever it's finished.
Was that a useful reply in your opinion? Do you think that I hadn't considered that?
Looking forward to play that game whenever it releases. It might be taking a long time, but the updates look better and better everytime!
Any chance people don't suggest ideas that will distract from actually delivering something core?

How about you kindly piss off? It's a suggestion and one for after release mainly so it really shouldn't distract from delivering the game. (Not to mention that creating said vinyl wouldn't be handled by them).
I'm not suggesting that the devs would be hand carving the grooves themselves.

Hello! I just wanted to tell Swery-san to hang in there. I know he's been dealing with a lot of negativity lately. Please don't be discouraged! It's a very stressful time right now and people are moved to act in anger far more easily than usual. Some of us know you're a good guy who's trying his best. You can't please everyone, but we know you're trying to be inclusive and understanding of many kinds of people.
I've backed the PC version but would like to change to PS4, is it possible?
I'm just curious, and the updates don't really help, but is the game released already or not? It says November 2019.. but I don't see a code or any platform to play it on..
The release got pushed back.

So I ordered a hoodie through backerkit a while back but now the link takes me to a survey with all the stuff in the tier I backed... I just want to make sure that if I were to add it I won't be charged twice for it...
I guess time will tell.

Apologies if this has previously been addressed, but are we able to change which digital version of the game we’ll receive as a backer? I initially selected one system, but would like to change it to the other. Thanks!
As it was proposed to come with Nov 2019 instead of "oh what groovy additional things we did" I would appreciate exact details about the development stage and when it will be released!
So.... is there a ballpark when this is coming out?
An email in March said the second half of this year

Limited Run sells collectors editions similar to the one on the $122 tier for $60-$80. Will everyone else get a much better deal on items than the supporters that waited for years? None of the components beyond the embossed box really sound like a costly item or did I miss an update on this. There weren’t a lot of options for a physical copy so the public getting it for 30-50 bucks isn’t a nice thing for supporters.

Do you mean The Awesome Life Tier? That includes two copies of the game though; a digital copy and a physical copy. I'm also not finding any information about Limited Run releasing a physical version outside of the kickstarter. Do you have a source for that by chance?

Was giving an example of the most relevant indie publisher in the market today. I apologize for the confusion. Even if you add together your digital copy and your collector's edition, you are hitting AAA prices almost. It also seems that Kickstarter developers are starting to hop on the digital wagon train of manuals, desktop schemes and things like that at a huge cost to the supporters. I will add you to my email push for 50 bucks more, woot! Including a digital copy in a collector's edition when you could easily make it a backer kit add-on is just a way to pad your sales for people that know some people need that physical collection no matter what it is weighted down with. Do I have a source? No, just some common sense and knowledge of the market.

Guys, when you will start to send surveys? Also how about CE for Xbox One version? Can I change PS4 version for Xbox One? And what about new consoles? Is this game will support PS5 and Xbox Series S/X?
Please help me get the game I backed, thanks!
According to bakerkit, the surveys have not yet been sent out. They haven't sent any emails out yet.

I'm so sorry I just clicked a frown face on the Kickstarter survey about my satisfaction. I didn't mean to! This has been one of the most satisfying Kickstarters front to back! Keep up the great work! Can't wait to play!
Is there any way we can change our backing to be for the Switch version? I'd be much more likely to play it on there.
I'd prefer that as well!
Every update makes me more and more excited for this game.
We need an update as to the actual release.
When will backers receive this? Do you have a form release date yet? I feel like it's been a long time and I'm worried this is never going to be produced.
They are aiming for spring 2020 now. It got announced in this update: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/476090608/the-good-life/posts/2574682
Is it safe?
I'm happy
Actually is deadly premonition actually made by swery San I'm getting a non team silent silent hill vibe from it
Is D.P.2 a switch exclusive ? I hope not as I dont own a switch IV only just got a PS4 lol
O.o Deadly Premonition 2! I was totally surprised watching the Nintendo direct today!

Well I might not be in the right tier to give a survey, but I'm still happy to be apart of the community. I can't wait to play this game! Take your time, and know that all of us are looking forward to every update!

I may be alone in this but since the game is coming out on PS4 and xbox I hope it can still come out on the Switch. I have no plans to get the other systems but would love to have my 2nd copy be for my Switch.

Please take your time! I can tell how much you care about this project and I'm fine with giving this project more time. You have been really honest and thorough with updates and im sure most of us are %100 on board. The character models now have a really nice, dynamic look. I love how Naomi's hair moves around a little now, and her walk cycle update is really nice. The close ups of character models also look fantastic. I'm glad you're making this game the best it can be and am totally looking forward to this experience.
Take all the time you need, you have our full support.
Swery is one of my favourite developers. Take all the time you need to make this as high a quality as possible.
I'm more than happy to wait. Quality takes time. The game is looking utterly fantastic so far!
Happy to get it when it's ready.
I'm good with the delay. Take the time to do it right. The game is already looking a lot better so I know you're all working hard.

I just want SWERY and the team to know that the delay is definitely for the best. I'm sure most people don't want the game to be rushed, and I'd rather the developers don't crunch or overwork themselves. I'm happy with this new update, and the game looks a lot better! As a fan of SWERY I've never been disappointed. Thanks for all the hard work.
Thank you for the update although news of the delay is disappointing (if a little expected) I'm hopeful that this results in a better product but not at the expense of any developer's health.

A lot of people can be childish and pissy about delays in Kickstarter games but the truth is, I would the game be perfect and completely on physical media rather than a huge download on Day 1. If you had to delay 2 years but we got a perfect product that was for the PS5, that works for me. Bloodstained and others have given Kickstarter a bad name. Make the game you envisioned in the time needed and maybe you do something special for your kickstarter backers that wont be done for your retail customers. Nothing like additional story lines that would be unfair to players but DLC or a quality pin that is NEVER given to others, that would be awesome. On top of not delivering what they promised, many kickstarter developers turn around and give the "Kickstarter special items" out for free later on and that is dispicable. You don't spit on the people that helped you achieve your dream. Keep working on your game and I look forward to playing it, when the best version of that is ready!
My enjoyment of the game won't be reduced because of a delay. You have clearly thought about this way in advance before Q4, so it seems a sensible choice.
No worries about the delay guys just make it the best it can be and I will play it
John
Good luck with everything ya'll! <3
I hope that you keep on "not discussing any exclusives".
Please make the game with support for Portuguese, it will be extremely interesting to play in my mother language.
The new updates look great! I love the new characters, they feel %100 Swery.
Yes, the concept art for the townsfolk and their animal forms have been my favorite part of the updates.
Please don't make this epic exclusive.
It says it is coming out on Steam right there under the logo, so I think we're safe.
Will people who backed the PS4 version on here be able to switch to the Xbox One version now that it's going to be there, too?
That would be cool but, I doubt it, on the bright side it was announced as a day one release on Xbox Game Pass if that helps.
Keep up the good work!
Great job with the new update! Love the new quirky character roster and customizable garden
Yay a new update the walking animation and character models are coming along fine good stuff
A third on requesting against Epic exclusivity. They have yet to do anything that has actually bothered me yet, but something has felt fishy about them from the moment I heard about them.
On a more serious note: White Owls please DO NOT make an exclusivity deal with epic.

With what's going on in the indystry recently I need to write something, White Owl. Please, I beg you, don't make this game Epic Store exclusive. I really want to play this as soon as it's released but there is no way Epic launcher is coming anywhere near my computer.
I can't wait to play this! Thanks for the updates!
Happy new year! I hope the development stays on track.
Merry Christmas!
I really like to see all the minor tests that you show us. As well as the research you did for the games. :)
The post about the animal movement looks great! So excited.
From what I understand yes
So the Collector's editions on Backer kit are the same one that will be made by Limited Run?
I backed for updates, and am prolly gonna hope to be able to "pre-order" a digital copy on PC.
Pam
Can't wait to play the game :)

Really enjoyed your travelogue through some of rural England. It really does look beautiful there, great setting choice. I loved the look of the town in your bicycling video. It has that flow of starting at the top of a hill and gliding down. I'm excited to see future updates on this.
Really looking forward to this game!
Kinda surreal to hear you have been knocking about near where I'm from

Hi, thank you for a fantastic update about your trip to the UK. It actually made me want to visit Japan... I was genuinely amazed that what seems so normal to me, was quite so alien to you! You even brought your own food with you because you thought English food would be so bad. I'm so glad that you were proven so wrong!
Hot Fuzz is a good movie. Good choice, Jack.
Well, that and Hot Fuzz.
Man, these issues people are having sound weird. Glad my payment went through okay, at least. I hope it all works out in the end.
銀行は支払いを拒否した。私はゲーム開発をサポートしたい。方法を教えてください。
Yea it's is somewhat worrying I hope it doesn't mess things about to much overall
Fortunately I was able to solve this over the phone. Looks like many other backers weren't so fortunate :(
FK in the coffee !
But NOT to be taken literally I ment to type
But it would ease the pain 😉
You're still not done, Adam?
its almost as if he was never actually a good designer
Also I think you should issue an apology not just to me but to all who played spy fiction that endured the laser room stage
@Henrik Rosén: Oh...So that is why my card didn't work either. Had to borrow dad's credit card which worked fine.
My card went through fine. I used my bank visa debit that has a 3 digit on the back and it's on my statement as Kickstarter. I was also the 5000¥ tier, so it was $46 and change.
What is the estimated amount of time in each in-game day?

Oddly enough, my pledge went through when I corrected my card info (I still had an expired card listed when the project ended so I had a different payment failure). Hopefully Kickstarter Japan gives dropped backers a chance to back again after they fix their issues.

My card is a debit card that uses cvv2 payment came out right away or should I say to my understanding it uses cvv2 if cvv2 is the 3 digits on the back of the card also I wonder if the amount bidded is a factor as I opted for the early bird digital version of the game witch was about £25 .Do the folk having issues with payments pledge a large amount ?

Not sure what the issue is but any attempts to reach out to Kickstarter directly were met with silence. I really hope there's a way to back the project after this campaign closes because it really sucks that the developers are going to miss out on a significant number of pledges because of something that should be easy for Kickstarter to resolve.
Anyway, happy I got it to work but Kickstarter Japan really needs to review how they collect pledges. White Owls are gonna lose a lot of backers because Kickstarter Japan messed this up.
May not be possible for me to make my pledge as Kickstarter won't process my payment, just in case, sorry Swery.

Chiming in to add my experience. I have reached out to my bank several times. I have a Visa debit card and my bank states that the rejection is happening on the Visa side of things, so they don't have a way to either confirm or deny the payment authorization on the card because it's being done specific to the vendor and is not a full fraud-block on my card. Trying to figure out if there's a way to reach out to Visa directly, but my bank didn't have any contacts I could use. Not sure how to proceed since this card is the only Kickstarter supported method of payment I have. I am really hoping the final word on this isn't that I just miss out on the collector's edition of this game that I was really looking forward to because Kickstarter isn't flexible with their payment system.

I'm from Germany and my pledge was collected even though it was the first ever "foreign" transaction for my Visa. Just to leave something positive here! I hope not too many people have problems and those can be resolved soon...

I know some people have suggested this before, but maybe set up a Paypal account for extra donations? I know some people that wouldn't mind tossing another ten or some odd amount that wouldn't meet any of the backerkit prizes. It would also help tide whatever is going on between bank accounts and KS right.

Woo! Took two trips to the bank, but thankfully it's right next to my work, so it was just a quick to walks over. Good news though is the pledge got processed! Hope everything works out for everyone else and it doesn't hurt the studio too much. I really want this game and for Swery and friends to be successful!
my pledge was was taken out today so I didn't have any problems anyway best of luck Swery.

Although I would have to work some early Saturdays I would be off the next, allowing me to live some of the Good. I would have to work some very early shifts. However they pay greatly for overtime. Life is good.
Anyway, best of luck with the game, even if I can't back it here I will definitly buy it once it's out!

Incredibly frustrating and terribly handled by kickstarter. campaign.story:
The Milky Way in a Sphere
The Universe Sphere
Did you ever want to hold the Universe in your hand? Wouldn´t it be cool to have a solid glass sphere with the structure of the Universe inside it? The success of our previous campaign "The Universe in a Sphere" showed us: Yes! But not only that, we got many requests if we continue making these spheres and if we plan to add more variants. We realized quite fast, that the Milky Way is a must have, especially if you already own the Universe in a Sphere. 
In this sphere, every one of the 300,000 tiny dots represents an entire Galaxy. Due to the Milky Way being represented by only a single dot within the Universe Sphere, the vast amount of stars per Galaxy is hard to understand.
Never mind, human can try do understand, so we decided to create a collection of Spheres. We want to go from huge to small, with the Universe in a Sphere as our our big bang, continuing with the Milky Way in a Sphere and only stop if you say: Please stop it, we don´t need more beautiful glass Spheres. 
Hoping, that this will never happen, we already worked on many Ideas like The Sun in a Sphere, The Solar System in a Sphere, Elon Musk´s Tesla in a Sphere, The Earth in a Sphere, Bacteria/Virus/Molecules in a Sphere, DNA in a Sphere, Atom in a Sphere. So stay tuned and now:
Let´s start with "The Milky Way in a Sphere"...
Hexgrid Base, LED Set, Round Base
If you google the Milky Way, you will find many beautiful pictures, fantastic animations and pretty decent maps. But after some research, you realize, a lot of it is artwork. 
To make it short, it´s because a Galaxy is so stupendously huge, that it would take approximately 1,000 years with the speed of light, alone to reach a point from where you might see the other end of our Galaxy. If you stay inside it, you can´t see the forest for the trees. Especially the center is so crowded and bright, that you have no chance to see through...
This sun, our sun, seems to have around 200,000,000,000 brothers and sisters. Two hundred billion stars that rotate with a speed between 20 and 200 kilometers per second in the shape of a giant disk. There are 1 million times more stars in our Galaxy, than dots in one Milky Way Sphere.
The diameter of the disk is
150,000 light years (1,400,000,000,000,000,000 km) and it is
2,000 light years thin (190,000,000,000,000,000 km). Our closest neighbor is the star Proxima Centauri, which is apProximately 4 light years away (37,000,000,000,000 km). In these dimensions, movement is hard to notice and you can easily forget, that it´s only a matter of perspective and time .The sun circles the Milky Way every 220 mio years...
PLAY

Video:(http://beltoforion.de/article.php?a=spiral_galaxy_renderer, music: Unicorn Heads)
How do we know, what our Galaxy looks like?
We will answer this question, right after the break, in which we show you, what you get if you support this campaign and why we need you.
What do you get?
If you support this campaign, you can choose between "The Milky Way in a Sphere", "The Universe in a Sphere", different bundles, 3D printed bases and an LED Base plate. You can get the LED Base plate by simply adding 10 € to your pledge. It has different changeable color sets, but does not rotate the sphere. "The Milky Way in a Sphere" is still in progress, but the first prototypes and the previous Spheres are already convincingly beautiful. 
The Milky Way in a Sphere V1, The Universe in a Sphere, Gift Box and Flyer.
We will offer the most favored bases of our previous campaign in order to prevent having 300 different variants to pack, like last campaign. If you want a special material or color we do not offer, you can visit our shop at
https://www.shapeways.com/shops/cinks-labs  
where you can order our bases (you will not be able, to buy the LED base plate there). Shapeways is a 3D printing company with its seat in Europe and the US.
Round Base, Hex Grid Base, LED Base plate, LED Fitting Base + LED Base plate
LED Base Plate + LED Fitting Base, The Universe Sphere on the LED Base Plate, different colors and materials of 3D printed bases.
Now we want to lay the groundwork for future campaigns and designs, as well as we want to finish our second Sphere, "The Milky Way in a Sphere". We asked a friend, who leads a company for movie post-production, to help us and he has done some awesome work. Together, we designed the second prototype, which looked so impressive, that we are super hyped for the next projects. 
The two prototype stages
How is the Milky Way measured and how much can we see?
We wanted to get the data for the Milky Way in a Sphere as detailed and true as possible, so we looked up, how the Galaxy was measured and who did it.
We found out, that the ESA (European Space Agency) sent the satellite Hipparcos into space, to map out the stars between 1989 and 1993.
That´s a while back, we thought, there must be more recent data...
The ESA sent another satellite in 2013, the Gaia mission, which revealed first data in 2016. We downloaded the data, opened it in excel and wondered, why there are no x-y-z coordinates? After some research, we noticed we have to transpose the data. Longitude (l), Latitude (b), Parallax, geometry, we had to remember the good old school days, learn something new and voilà, after several hours we were able to calculate our x,y,z.

Distance = d=1/Parallax
X = d*cos(b)*cos(l)
Y = d*cos(b)*sin(l)
Z = d*sin(b)
Does not look like the Milky Way that much
What do we see here? After some research and a phone call with a professor of the University of Astrophysics in Potsdam, our guess became true, it´s only a fraction of the whole. That fraction is pretty good measured, but again, the forest for the trees. With that knowledge, we found visualizations of the Gaia data and we became sure, we need more data to design the Milky Way.
Credits: X. Luri & the DPAC-CU2. Simulations based on an adaptation for Gaia of the Besançon galaxy model (A. Robin et al.) https://www.cosmos.esa.int/web/gaia/iow_20110810
So we looked up more data. We found different infrared data, stellar density data, data catalogues like tgas and hyparcos, pictures, photos and we built the first prototype. It looked good, but not awesome. Every dot had the same size and the arms were hard to mention.
We hired Ronald and his company “BASIS KG” from Vienna, Austria and together we took our images, datasets and 3D models to create the second prototype. 
"First, we concentrated on the stars in the arms and made them more visible and highlighted. After that, we selected the data from the bright star clusters and gave them more volume by adding stars. Next was to bring the stardust and all the asteroids into the Sphere and we decided to phase them out from the center to the edge"
After several hours of work we finally got the result and were so impressed, that we instantly ordered our prototypes...This is the first footage of our new Sphere, but we might improve it and its production  during the two month of our campaign.
Stretch goals
100.000 € - The Milky Way in a pocket cube At 100.000 € we want to add the option for tiny glass cubes containing the Milky Way, that cost only 10€. 
200.000 € - The big sphere At 200.000 € we want to add the big 15 cm sphere, which still needs more development
306.970 € - Designed product packing 
At 306.970 €, the finish line of our previous campaign, we want to hire a company for professional packing, so the bases and spheres fit inside one designed box.
The prototype of the big sphere vs. the regular sphere. We will make another campaign for the big sphere, because it needs more development.
How is it made?
To show the laser etching process, we made a video of a cube, because it is better to see.
The Pocket Milky Way
   The Pocket Milky Way 3x3x1 cm
Testimonials
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like in the past campaigns, it´s still necessary for us to produce a larger amount of spheres, to lower the production costs and make it affordable for many people. We have learned, that there will always be costs you can´t predict and we were really happy, that the initial campaign was such a huge success. 

We also had some trouble with our shipping service provider, who messed up 3000 tracking codes, falsely rejected 200 packages because of the batteries. At the end, we delivered all these Spheres, but this cost us quite some time and nerves. Nonetheless, we are more than confident, that we will also overcome any future hurdles. 

Together, we successfully finished two big campaigns on Kickstarter, but we are still only two brothers, who are in the progress of building their company. Therefore, it happened from time to time, that we had delays in answering mails.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: A New Campaign! The Finest Scientific Glass Art!
updates.update_content:
This time, the development of probably the most extraordinary creatures of our planet, even if unlikely, perhaps the whole universe.
The Earthling in a Sphere: Join Now

Hi supporters,
We hope you are all loving your glass art! Today, we have a big announcement for you: We’ve launched a new campaign!
We’re taking you from macro to micro with the Microcosm in Glass: Viruses, Bacteria, and Cells laser etched in the crystal glass you know and love.

updates.update_userinfo: Gogo on Indigogo - We Want to Reach New Coasts to Find New Treasures, Join Us so You Don´T Miss Any!
updates.update_content: Of course we will come back and launch our new innovative projects on Kickstarter first because Kickstarter was the Kickstarter that made us successful. Nonetheless, we also want to take the chance and find new supporters on Indigogo. For this reason, we decided to make a product, that is either new nor already existing, the Milk-E-Wall. This one centimeter thick glass is illuminated by RGB Leds and has the Milky Way laser etched inside. We plan different variants, from small to large. The largest will be 40x40 cm.

updates.update_userinfo: Ludi Incipiant, Let The Games Begin...
updates.update_content:
We have some good news for you. Our laser is working, which means that the production is in full swing again. We expect the first 400 spheres at the beginning of next week and then we can start shipping them at the end of next week. 
We hope that we can send out all missing packages within the next two weeks and then we can start shipping the preorders and complaints.

No Blood and No Bone, the Diode Though Gone, It Must Be Repaired, a Delay Is Declared.
Bad news everyone, ok not everyone, but those who still wait for their goods. After 9 years of good work, the laser diode of the machine that was used for our spheres died. Such a diode costs around 24.000€, which is not a huge problem because it was predictable, but that is the reason, why there is no other diode somewhere in the locker. On Monday we will know, whether the diode can be repaired or needs to be changed. Either way, this will need 4-5 weeks until the production can continue as usual.

updates.update_userinfo: The Game and the Sphere, the Star Constellations Are Near.

Also, Some Info´s About Shipping and a Few Q&A´S
At first, I want to thank you in the name of our employees, which are at the moment 3 plus my brother and me, for all the beautiful comments, nice emails and heartwarming words. This is the mana, that gives us the power to go on and continue working on our dream, our products, and our ideas...

campaign.story:
To show our appreciation, Flick Labs Team will include a FREE CAMEO360 T-SHIRT to all backers who pledge $175 or more
    There are many available action cameras in the market, but they are either too expensive or offer limited capabilities. Creating the perfect videos can also be both difficult and time consuming.
That's why we created CAMEO360 - The world's smallest dual lens 360º 4K active camera that helps you create and share quality photos and videos in easy ways.  
                     PLAY

    Take the jarring motion out and capture smooth handheld quality video.
  Share your 360º Live moments directly through Facebook and Youtube whether you are traveling or attending the events.
    Simple One Button Control for you to capture your photos and videos.
  CAMEO360 only weighs 96g and it fits in you pocket. 
   CAMEO360 is waterproof up to 30ft.
  Capture high quality photos and videos with CAMEO360 and share your moments on social media channels like Facebook, Instagram,etc... whether you are traveling or attending your favorite events.
  Over the Air (OTA) Update Capability allows you to update your CAMEO360, making it better every quarter. 
    This is the sample photo and video from our CURRENT prototype. We will update backers with more videos and photos after the final CAMEO360 is approved. Please click on the link on Youtube to see the 360 view on Youtube. Use the mouse to move the image around https://youtu.be/OtP-d_uCU24.
NOTE: Youtube has sub-optimal quality in 360.
    PLAY

Built-in Stitching Video
  Download the Flicksee App to access all the advance features of CAMEO360 with your smart phone and easily share your moments with a new social media community and other popular social media channels. 
Flicksee App Screen
  Pair CAMEO360 with Flicksee App through Wifi
    Preview your videos in different shooting modes
    Personalize your videos with combination of fun filters
    Share & monetize your creation with Flicksee App
                         Exact shipping rates will vary depending on destination, but will not exceed 50 USD per reward. CAMEO360 rewards will be shipped according to each Kickstarter pledge order. You should move fast to be one of the first to get their hands on CAMEO360, and join the community! 
Our team’s effort on our development started in October 2015, we broke down our process to two stages to build both our app and our 360° camera. First, our global collaboration with top engineers coming from top Fortune 500 companies such as Microsoft and Texas Instrument to develop a product that is durable, high-quality, energy efficient, and easy to use.
Most small cameras in the market practically use the same type of schematics and offer limited capabilities. We created an active camera with 4K quality and dual lenses to give you more access to capture your moments in many different ways. 
 Second, our team created the Flicksee App to be the perfect pair with the versatile CAMEO360 for you to easily access all the advance features to capture your moments. The Flicksee app gives you access to a new social media platform welcoming you to a new community, and allow you to easily share your moments with other popular social media channel. We streamlined the process of content creation to sharing so you can concentrate on what you do best and have fun. 
  Coming from California we believe design does matters. Our prototype offers a simple portable design, but our final production design will give the CAMEO360 a premium, sleek, and portable design you will be proud to carry and take out of your pocket anytime. 
      We teamed up with our manufacturing partner almost over a year ago. This is one of the two leading core manufacturers for action cameras in the market. Their vast experience in Original Design Manufacturing(ODM) gives our team an edge to be close to both design and manufacturing to have an advantage in both efficiency and cost effectiveness.
                  We aligned ourselves with one of the top manufacturing of action cameras in the world, and we guarantee our product will be of top quality. We developed Cameo360 and Flicksee App to give our supporters the most fun, unique, user-friendly, and convenient experience with creating and sharing your moments. Right now, YOU can choose which projects and technologies becomes a reality. Help us bring the most versatile smallest dual lens 360° 4K active camera into everyone’s hands by backing us now.  
   We’ve made a FAQ section below, and we will be adding new FAQs as we go along. Our team will be keeping you up to date with Kickstarter Updates, messages, and via the Comment wall. Please, feel free to reach out to us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are delivering both hardware and software support product, and our team is uniquely positioned to deliver something that has never been done before by a start-up. We are ready to launch our camera and our mobile sharing community app and we are ready for manufacturing. 

With our team’s solid background in marketing, we are confident we will be able to connect every individual and make our world smaller. Our biggest challenge and highest priority is to give the highest quality product and service. Your initial support will help us make that possible. Delays have been a big concern for many backers and we have given ourselves an extended delivery timetable and fore-sighted any potential delays to make sure we get the Cameo360 Camera into your hands. However, demand may exceed supply and there could be delays beyond our control. We may slightly modify the final design as we hit our stretch goal to provide our backers the highest quality and most advanced active camera in the market.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
