campaign.story:
At Grove, we want to help more people grow and eat sustainable, organic, and hyperlocal food.
We believe Grove can spark a movement towards trust and ownership in our food system, and we envision a future where people source most of their food from local farmers, from outside in their garden, and from inside their home. That's how we are committing to change the future of food, and we're proud to start with the Grove Ecosystem. 
We want to hear from you!
If you have questions, please give us a call (1-844-457-8500) or email us at kickstarter@grovelabs.io. We're available from 9a-9p EST and will do our best to respond to all email inquiries within a few hours. Thanks so much!
    We have two more stops in our nationwide Ecosystem demo tour! Register for SF and Brooklyn here using the code "friendofgrove" for free admission!
If you're not able to join us on the road, you can register for a personal video demo over Skype here. 
As Seen In...
The Grove Ecosystem is an intelligent, indoor garden that makes it possible to grow fresh, flavorful, and nutrient-rich food year round.
A Grove Ecosystem provides you with fresh, healthy produce, brings light and fresh air into your home, and empowers you to understand how to grow your own food.
The Ecosystem uses fish, plants, and beneficial microbes to reliably grow delicious produce - including vegetables, herbs, and small fruits - in a space the size of a bookshelf. Through the mobile app, Grove OS, you'll not only be able to control and automate the Ecosystem, but access decades of indoor growing knowledge which will in turn allow you to grow the healthiest, freshest produce for you and your family. 
The Ecosystem is a living system.
At the intersection of hardware, software, and ecology, the Ecosystem is a thoughtfully crafted fun, educational, and rewarding experience.
Getting started is easy. The Ecosystem ships with everything you need to get up and running immediately. Grove OS walks you through the entire process - from planting your first seeds, to adding fish to your tank, to harvesting your first crops. As your seeds turn into sprouts and your plants become ready to harvest, Grove OS measures the health of your system and lets you know when to step in. In just a month and a half you can expect to be harvesting fresh, organic produce!
There are thousands of unique edible plants you can grow. Typical grocery stores carry about 50-60. 
The Grove Ecosystem will expand your palette, helping you grow a wide variety of plants from herbs to leafy greens to fruiting crops. Here's a shortlist of crops our early customers have been successfully growing in Ecosystem prototypes! 
Please refer to the FAQ section for a full list of what can be grown in the Ecosystem.
Our ecology team has been extensively researching the growing best practices which have been integrated into the Grove OS mobile app. Simply tell Grove OS what you have planted, and the Ecosystem automates lighting, watering, and fans to optimize the growth of your crops.
Trust the food you eat, because you grew it.
Growing Technical Specifications
Grow Area: MGB - 25.25 x 11.5 in / SGB - 20 x 10.5 inches 
Canopy Clearance: MGB - 28 in / SGB - 8 in
Root Zone Depth: MGB - 8 in / SGB - 3 in
Grow Medium: Clay Pebbles
 MGB = Main Grow Bed / SGB = Seedling and Greens Bed
Aquaponics in Action
The Ecosystem utilizes a natural process called aquaponics, which harnesses the relationships between beneficial bacteria, fish, and plants to reliably grow fresh, delicious produce. 
The fish process the food they are fed and produce ammonia-rich waste. Beneficial microbes convert the ammonia to nitrates (organic plant fertilizer), simultaneously supplying the plants with nutrients and the fish with clean water!
As a result of this natural process, you don't have to clean the tank, wash your greens, or worry about the freshness of your food! 
Intelligent and ecologically sound, the Grove Ecosystem, is designed to look beautiful in the home, grow fresh and flavorful food, and engage and inspire you, your family, and your friends. Over time, the system learns with you by collecting data and helping you optimize for flavor, freshness, and yield.
A Connected, Intelligent Device
The Ecosystem creates an ideal environment for your fish and plants by controlling lights, fans, and pumps based on readings from air temperature, humidity, water temperature, and water level sensors. All the tools and training you need to become an aquaponics expert are wrapped up into a fun experience on your phone. Visualize your progress, track plant growth, and diagnose problems instantly.
Smart sensors and Wi-Fi connectivity help you cultivate a healthy Ecosystem 24/7.
Full Spectrum, Adjustable LED Lights
Custom-engineered by our electrical engineering team, the Ecosystem's LEDs are full spectrum (2000K – 5000K), fully dimmable, and automated to mimic the sun to power optimal photosynthesis. The lights can also be vertically adjusted to the height of your plants to maximize their growing efficiency.
The Ecosystem contains white LED panels that not only look great in the home, but are best-in-class grow lights.
A Large Main Growing Area
The Ecosystem boasts a grow bed with 305 sq inches of grow area and a depth of 8 inches for plenty of healthy root space. With a constant supply of water, nutrients and quality light you can expect a higher level of production than typically seen in an outdoor garden. Additionally, you can plant your crops much denser than in outdoor soil. 
When planted with heirloom lettuce and starting seeds in the dedicated seedling area, you'll harvest the freshest greens every night (about the equivalent of about 2-3 bags of salad greens every week or 8 - 10 heads of lettuce every 20 days).
Tomatoes to cilantro. Peppers to arugula. Harvest a bounty with plenty of grow space.
Microgreens and Seedling Bed
The Ecosystem's seedlings and greens bed (SGB) is 230 square inches and perfect for seedlings and microgreens. Once your seedlings are ready, move them to the upper grow bed and watch them reach maturity. 
Increase your productivity with dedicated seedling grow space.
Self-Filtering Aquarium
The Ecosystem's 25 gallon fish tank is where the aquaponic cycle starts. Incorporating integrated aeration and lighting, the 3/8 inch thick acrylic housing is the home for your fish, shrimp, and snails as they create the waste that eventually becomes the fertilizer that is cycled throughout the system. 
Naturally balanced as part of the larger ecosystem, this stunning aquatic habitat will replace your flat screen TV.
Integrated Storage Space
Designed into the front panel of the Ecosystem is an inconspicuous storage area and workbench for many of the tools you need - seed packets, fish food, nutrient supplements, scissors, and an aquaponics test kit (for testing pH, ammonia, nitrite, and nitrates). See the FAQ for everything that is included in your Ecosystem purchase. 
Integrated storage and work surface for everything you need to tend to your ecosystem.
Hardware Technical Specifications
Dimensions: 34" W x 16" D x 54-75" T
Weight: 115lbs Empty / 400lbs Full
Energy Use: 112 kWh / month*  
Wood: Amber bamboo
Grove OS is designed so you can keep it simple with default settings, or delve in and finely tune all aspects or your Ecosystem. We've programmed the app with decades of growing knowledge to intelligently control your Ecosystem and serve as a handy gardening guide.
Plant Presets
Ecosystem Controls
Our custom LED lights are controlled right from your phone. Presets make harvesting in the dark or Instagramming your luscious greens as easy as opening your phone. 
Grove Almanac
Everything you need to be an expert. Our knowledge base on smart indoor gardening, aquaponics, and ecology is constantly growing, including hacks and DIY projects to help you explore! 
Push Notifications
Nature is at work in your Ecosystem, and Grove OS is your translator. Plant and fish tracking combine with sensor data to give you timely notifications about what your system needs.
Vacation Mode
Grove OS puts your lights in low-energy mode and conserves water, making it safe to leave an Ecosystem unattended for over a week. 
Grove OS Technical Specifications
Control: Watering, Light cycles, Light spectrum, Light intensity, Airflow sensor readings, System status warnings
Compatibility: iOS (March 2016), Android (April 2016)
Whether you're planting your first seed or you live in the soil for half the year, feel at home in our thriving community! We're ready and excited to support you every step of the way.
Grove Community
Grove Community is an online platform to connect with other Grove growers, fresh food enthusiasts, and passionate aquaponic growers. You can ask questions, share tips, post success photos, and revel in your organic experiences! 
Grove Market
The Grove Market is our online marketplace for all your Ecosystem needs. Need more seeds? pH adjuster? Another seedling tray? We have a curated supply list of everything you'll need to keep your Ecosystem running healthily and happily. Simply visit the Market, select what you need, and we'll ship it to your doorstep. 
Personalized Support
From planting to harvesting, our growing team is always here to assist you. No question is too small (or too complex). We're here for emotional and technical support!
Our support team loves assisting and empowering our Grove growers with all the resources and tips they need to be successful!
Right Now, 50 Early Adopters in Boston Love Their (prototype) Grove Ecosystems 
These prototypes (which look a bit different from the Grove Ecosystem we're excited to share with you today) have been used and loved by 50 Early Adopters in Boston for the past six months. See what they have to say about their Grove growing experience:
We've iterated on our design based on feedback from our Boston Early Adopters. The new Ecosystem has improved Wi-Fi connectivity, a 1.5x larger gardening bed, and a 3x larger aquarium (for healthier, happier fish). Additionally, we've optimized the LEDs for better growing, added a dedicated grow space for seedlings and microgreens, and have refined Grove OS. 
Like you saw above with our Boston Early Adopter program, this isn't our first rodeo. We already have an assembly line in place, fully built out hardware, software, and ecology teams, and have already delivered 50 prototype units. We have the same hardware vendors, 9+ months of ecology testing, and a new mobile app far into development. This is our month-by-month plan from now until delivery: 
The Ecosystem runs on the Photon microcontroller and the Particle platform. This open-source, cloud platform made it quick to get started, and gives us a straightforward path to production and scale. With the Photon, setting up the Ecosystem on wifi and pushing out firmware updates over-the-air are simple, well-tested processes. We’ve been working with the Particle team for the past year and are significant contributors to their software projects.
You're Supporting a Passionate, Dedicated, Experienced, and Revolutionary Team
We’re a passionate team of MIT engineers, entrepreneurs and inventors, modern farmers, Harvard biologists, designers, food lovers, and impact-driven problem solvers dedicated to developing technology, products, and experiences that enable more people to grow their own food in productive home ecosystems. We're united by our desire to positively change our world, and we believe that starts with food and sustainability. 
Our core team brings wisdom and experience from SpaceX, Apple, the United States Air Force, the Australian Army, NOLS, GrabCAD, and an ecosystem research farm in West Virginia. Our backgrounds are diverse, but we’re united by a common mission. We're also fortunate to have a group of advisors, partners, and investors who are contributing their wisdom, capabilities, and networks to help us maximize our positive impact.
From Our Founders: It's time we learn to live with nature, not against it.
Our reason for starting this project is simple: food production is unsustainable and unhealthy. Co-founders Gabe and Jamie lived together in an MIT fraternity in winter of 2013 when Jamie, frustrated with the current state of food and agriculture, took matters into his own hands and built an aquaponics system in their shared room. After loving that first system, Gabe and Jamie decided to build a beautiful, fun solution to this problem by combining an indoor garden and a Farmville-like mobile app.
Follow us on this adventure!
* Based on typical monthly usage.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We plan on being transparent with our process and challenges. 

Similar to many Kickstarter projects, we face several risks and challenges in sparking this growing revolution. Unlike many Kickstarter projects, we have raised outside venture capital and, as a team, we already have built and shipped over 50 of our beta prototypes.

To further de-risk our project, our fantastic investors have offered Grove an additional capital immediately following the campaign if we are successful in reaching a certain Kickstarter funding goal. This capital will accelerate us towards a company that can deliver on the Grove Ecosystem, and also begin development on future products and services that can help educate and inspire even more people on healthy food, indoor growing, and aquaponics.

Primary risks for us include:

ENGINEERING

To achieve the level of simplicity in user experience that we aspire to, we have to finalize design and engineering on a complex system. We have taken two key steps to ensure our engineering success. 1) We have formed an amazing, experienced team of engineers and designers, and 2) we have tested our prototypes for over a year. We've built seven generations of prototypes culminating in a prototype "Early Adopter" production run (50 Grove EA Ecosystems are growing in homes around the Boston area). We've already ironed out all the kinks and we're harnessing enormous amounts of data (both qualitative and quantitative) to guide our future work.

SUPPLY CHAIN AND LOGISTICS

Many Kickstarter campaigns encounter problems when taking their prototypes to production, often stemming from issues finding suppliers and engineering products for mass-production. Smooth execution is essential to overcoming supply chain and logistics risks. Enough capital is also critical. We take this lesson seriously and have been working for months negotiating with suppliers, testing component quality, and building a team that can execute on our plan. We have already done a small scale assembly run of 50+ EA Ecosystems, and although our design has improved significantly with all the feedback, we will be using mostly the same manufacturing partners, processes, and logistics. Our plans are in place, and we now mainly require the resources, backing, and support to execute them!

TEAM

Finding the right people is a challenge for any endeavor. Success in such a complex and multi-disciplinary field as indoor growing requires a team of talented, passionate, and motivated designers, engineers, ecologists and entrepreneurs. We have formed a talented, passionate, fun team, but we will have to recruit more Grovers to realize our vision :) We're excited about that as we believe our team is our strongest asset. Oh, and you, our backers! Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
AeroPro is a personal aeroponic plant propagation and grow system.
It is unlike any other aeroponic system on the market today. This patent-pending design utilizes a piezoelectric atomizer, which converts water into vapor, instead of using a high-powered mister. 
What Makes It Different Than Any Other Aeroponic or Hydroponic System? 
AeroPro was intentionally designed to be a compact grow system. Most hydroponic and aeroponic systems need a lot of space and power to function, and not everyone has that space. We challenged ourselves to create something that was small enough to fit in an apartment kitchen, and efficient enough to produce and sustain extremely healthy plants. Here are just a few benefits to gardening with AeroPro:
Designed With The Environment In Mind.
AeroPro is environmentally friendly and energy efficient. The system works on only 4 watts of energy, and can be plugged into any USB port or electrical outlet. Its automatic shut off, will eliminate any worry about it overheating or shorting out if you accidentally leave it on.
Power It With The Sun.
AeroPro runs on solar!
Use Less Water!
AeroPro uses ¼ cup of water for every 4 hours of run time, eliminating the need for large reservoirs which produce significant water waste. Plants will only absorb what they need, and the excess moisture will evaporate. 
We’ve made it simple. 
With AeroPro, you no longer have to worry about overwatering your plants. Just transplant them into a soilless substrate such as coconut bark or sphagnum moss and turn on the system. It’s that simple.
The system has successfully grown and sustained a variety of plants. We have tested herbs, vegetables, fruit and florals. It has germinated tomato seeds in as few as 2 days, and has even extended the bloom time of an orchid up to 8 months. 
We’re planting a seed starting with the Kickstarter community, and would like to offer you an opportunity to support this project. We have some great rewards available only to our Kickstarter backers, so make sure to select a pledge and let’s grow something together.
Production Timeline
We have spent the last 3 years designing, and testing several iterations of this product, and are finally ready to go to market. We have identified manufacturing, and are working to minimize production costs to offer the system at an affordable price. With your support, we will be able to meet the minimum production requirements to bring AeroPro to homes everywhere. 
Reward Options 
  CAMPAIGN APPAREL AVAILABLE
 About Us
John Reints and Tom Pytel
John and I have been working together for the past four years, developing award-winning marketing and sales campaigns. As marketing executives, we share a passion for innovative design and healthy market disruption. Vertiponics is our first startup venture together.

campaign.story:
An ecosystem in its simplest form. Plants and fish - thriving together in a stylish, simple-to-maintain aquaponics system. Keep a piece of nature wherever you are.
Unlike other systems on the market, Vita has no mechanical filters to change because it uses a natural aquaponic system to clean itself. The plant naturally filters your water creating a clean habitat for your fish. Every element works together for easy maintenance without any of the hassle.
It's minimalistic aesthetic brings out the best in your plants brightening up any room. The elegant design brings tranquility into your home or work space. Scientific studies have shown that a plant-rich environment can boost creativity and productivity while aquarium keeping has a significant effect in reducing levels of stress and anxiety.
                                              Staying true to nature, we’ve designed the Vita to work without using electricity. Zero electricity means no wires, meaning you can place your Vita wherever you want. It's compact, portable, and blends into any space anywhere.
                                              The sleek, elegant design complements any room the Vita is placed in. Vita uses high quality SuperBright™ 5mm glass making it extremely durable and provides excellent viewing properties to see the fish. Each tank is different with hand selected natural stones included in each individual Aquascaping kit. The sustainable plant media retains moisture and provides the perfect ventilation for plant roots.
An optional touch LED lighting system is available to be included with your order. The plant light allows you to grow your Vita in locations that doesn’t have sunlight available allowing you to truly grow your Vita anywhere. The underwater light allows you to view your compact ecosystem at night. It even has a built in 10 hr timer! The RGB backlight allows you to customize your tank further and enjoy color therapy too.
See the Touch LED Light and remote (stretch goal) in action!
PLAY

The Vita is a low-maintenance aquarium that uses aquaponics to keep the plant and fish happy and healthy. Vita is simple to maintain because there are no working parts. You don’t need to maintain or change a filter.
Simply pour water into the aquarium, grow your plant, and watch it clean itself! It’s so easy anybody can do it!
Over-watering and under-watering are two of the biggest problems that result in poor plant growth. With the Vita, the plants naturally take water from the tank as needed so that you don’t have to water them yourself reducing the amount of water used up to 90%. This allows your houseplants to grow healthy and happy.
                                              Looking to get Vita international?
Please message us directly and we can discuss shipping rates!
Want to "add-on" to your pledge? Here's how it works.
1. Choose a reward level. 
Everybody must choose one (and only one) reward level to back this project. You cannot choose 2 reward levels. Just one. You will get all items in that reward. 
2. Increase your pledge amount to match the cost of the Add-On item you'd like.
For example, if you pledged $30 for the "VITA VIP SPECIAL" and you also want a Betta Fish ($7) and a LED Light and Transformer ($24), you would simply add $31 to your $30 pledge. So your pledge would be $61 total plus shipping.
3. Relax, you're all done!
At the end of the campaign we will send a survey to confirm everything like shipping information & add-on specifics. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to message us!
Not yet a backer? Click here:
Already a backer? Click here: 
                                              Ecoxotic continues to set the industry standard in aquatic LED lighting. Their LED lights illuminate public aquarium exhibits, zoological displays, living plant walls and hobbyist aquarium tanks worldwide. With over 50 years combined experience in aquariums, aquaculture and hydroponics, their team has the technical skills, entrepreneurial savvy and experience to tackle the challenge of bring Vita™ to life.
www.launchboom.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After years of working in the aquarium industry and creating our own products we know there can always be hurdles along the way during product development. Our experience has allowed us to mitigate much of the risk, but it still exists. We will always be transparent with our community about challenges, including these:

Ship Date: We are confident we will ship by the projected dates, as we are using manufacturers that have built our other products. While there is always a chance that things will take longer than planned, the experience with our manufacturers will definitely speed up the process!

Product Changes: As we refine the Vita based on additional community feedback and more product testing, slight changes may be made. We'll only make changes that enhance the product experience.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Please continue to be patient as we expect it to take 2-3 weeks to complete all shipments as we have nearly 2,200 Vitas to ship!  Once your order has shipped, you will receive an email notification with the tracking information from Fedex.

Hi Everyone!!  
We just wanted to give you a quick update on the Vita arrival! Our container officially arrived in port! However, we were just notified customs has held our container for a random intensive exam. This is a pretty normal and no need to get alarmed, but it will delay us an 3-5 extra days unfortunately.

To our Awesome Backers!! 
GOOD NEWS!! Final production on your Vita is 100% complete and we just received official confirmation from the China port that our container is on water and on its way to us in Vista, California.

Dear Backers,
It is with a heavy heart that we inform you on January 24th, we lost one of our youngest and brightest souls. Tara Robertson passed away at home with her beloved Labrador, Nala from a sudden cardiac event due to an undiagnosed condition called Cardiomyopathy. 
She was a huge part of our team, with the biggest heart and the brightest spirit. She will be sincerely missed and we all feel so honored to have worked with her. Please join us in paying public tribute to Tara on our Facebook pages. We ask that you bear with us during this difficult time.

I don't think bettas are big jumpers, but any fish except seahorses can jump if they get scared. Mostly new fish, who have not realized yet that the water surface is only a few inches above them, do it, and usually when they get scared like when the lights turn on or off for the first few times. The "safe" thing to do might be to cover the tank with a stocking or net for the first week, so the betta can get used to the water depth and the lighting.

@RobertPistey The Creator's diagram notwithstanding, water is drawn up from the tank through the wick where it is presented to the growth medium and to the roots of the plant. The "force" which creates this capillary action draft is the loss of water from the growth medium some to the plant but mostly evaporation to the room. Other than the wick, there is no communication from the growth medium back to the water in the tank. In my Vita, I need to top off the tank about ¼ inch of new water each day to make up for evaporation loss.

The substitute heater has no ON/OFF feature. It is constantly ON. That being said, its 5W rating limits the amount of heat introduced to the tank and does a reasonable job of keeping the water temperature within the range of temperatures which a betta can tolerate. Your room environment may make the heater more or less efficient than optimum for maintaining tank temperature so you should monitor water temperature regularly until you gain confidence with the heat input.

I was very, very excited to get my Vita and tried to be patient waiting for its arrival. However, once I got a shipment e-mail, I was checking the tracking every day! I started setting it up last night and I'm very impressed with some aspects and a little disappointed with others. I hope there will be a survey to fill out so that you all will be able to combine and analyze all of this feedback. The glass aquarium is beautiful! I have no issues with it not being square or having messy glue. There was a little bit of glue remnants on one side but they wiped away easily. I love the mesh bag that was included. This solves the problem I always have with worrying about tiny rocks going down the drain. I love the look the LED light gives the tank but did expect it to be cordless. I am disappointed with the heater. The campaign showed a flat heater that would hide under the rocks. Now, it's taking up space inside and doesn't look so elegant. In addition, the heater has no on/off option. If it's plugged in, it's on. This tells me that it will continually heat the water so now I have to go purchase a thermometer to add to the set-up. No matter what type I get, this will degrade the look of the tank even more. Additionally, I'm going to have to continually monitor the temperature and unplug the heater when it gets to the top limit of the acceptable temperature and then plug it back in when the water starts to cool too much. I'm going to have to do this over and over. Hopefully, it doesn't get too hot too fast. I think my fish would appreciate stable temperatures. As others have mentioned, the planting instructions are not included with the tank instructions. I'm not sure why especially when the LED light instructions ARE included. Seeing as the plant is a major aspect of the Vita, it doesn't make much sense that the customer is asked to research the plant instructions. Lastly, from what I can figure out, it seems the Pachypodium and Desert Rose need a warm environment. Since this is not the case with my house, I'm not sure how they will do. I'm going to try them but, I feel like they will not do well. I expect to go through the wheatgrass pretty quickly as I believe it's a fast growing plant. Once I have to pull it out, I'm going to have to go on the hunt for a plant that will grow in the tray and be appropriate for my home. My betta seems to love his new home. I hope once I get all of the kinks worked out/solved, I will love it just as much. In the meantime, it sure is pretty!

@Mary - I had a couple of Betta fish when I was a kid and I've been doing a lot of research in preparation for my future one. Each Betta is different - personality and coloring. Colors can vary greatly (blue, green, yellow, purple, red, etc.) and can be a single color or a combo of several. Males have larger fins (like the one in the campaign pictures) while females have smaller fins. Also, their personality or demeanor can vary from fish to fish. I had one that was really friendly. He followed my finger and always waited to be fed in the morning. My sister's was a bit more cranky and got agitated quickly. If you're ordering a Betta with your Vita, it will be a surprise as to which color Betta you will get and what kind of personality they will have. But I've always thought the surprise is part of the fun getting a new pet :)

"As long as a fish tank is at least 1 gallon of water, can provide room for a heater without worry for large temperature fluctuations, and room to swim, it can be an appropriate permanent betta fish home with proper maintenance and care."
Looks like we're good.
Alternatively, you could just get an old cup, like a Big Gulp for instance, and use that instead.

For water changes you CAN use tap water as long as you buy some dechlorinator solution available online or at your local pet store. Simply add the needed amount to your tap water in a container, mix, and you are good to go. I would recommend a 50% water change once a week at least on a tank like this one. It may sound difficult but it is actually extremely simple once you do it a couple times. For a tank this small you can just use an empty gallon milk jug that you have washed out as your container to refill the tank after the water change. To drain the water buy a simple piece of small tubing a few feet long to use as a siphon.

campaign.story:
GoBox is a fun and easy way to learn programming through a build-your-own robot kit with monthly robotics missions that are delivered right to your door! The first month, you’ll get the GoPiGo robot car, and every month after that you will be assigned a mission to accomplish! Each month, your GoBox will include a new sensor and step-by-step instructions on how to accomplish a mission -- complete with illustrations and links to helpful videos.
We believe that the more someone knows about the way technology works, the more effective and successful they will be in any career they choose. However, the way that technology - like engineering and computer science - is taught, caters to those with a specific style of learning, and can often be boring and frustrating for many of us because it requires so much background knowledge.
To solve this, we’re making an easy-to-use robot kit that will enable and excite anyone with any background to learn about coding and technology.
With the GoBox, you and your child can explore robotics and programming together, from the beginning. If your skills are more advanced, your monthly GoBox still gives you a fun way to connect, create, and explore new concepts alongside your child, niece or grandchild.
Stretch Goals!
We've reached our initial funding goals rather quickly so we are laying out some stretch goals!
Stretch Goal 1 ($60,000): We heart Python.  If we reach this stretch goal, we will create parallel materials for each lesson in Python.
Stretch Goal 2 ($100,000): Where do robots come from?  We'll develop a feature video that explains how we design and manufacture our robot.
What is the GoPiGo? 
The GoPiGo is the foundation of GoBox. GoPiGo is a robot car we designed, built, and launched last year. With the awesome feedback we received from thousands of users and our thriving, creative community, we have learned how to make it easier to assemble, more durable, and a lot more fun to use! All of these improvements will be included in the GoPiGo2, as a part of this GoBox Kickstarter! 
Programming 
The GoPiGo is built around a really neat $35 single board computer called the Raspberry Pi (the green board in the picture below). It was developed by a UK foundation a few years back and has taken the education world by storm -- making it easier than ever for young people to get their hands on electronics and learn to program. It's easy to use, and we think it's the best platform for beginners because it doesn't require any prior knowledge. 
Read more about the Raspberry Pi and the Non-Profit Foundation that supports it here.
The GoBox and the GoPiGo Raspberry Pi Robot Car are part of the Open Source Hardware Community.
Programming Languages
You can program the GoPiGo in many languages including Python, Scratch, Node.js, and Go. Our awesome community has even developed Windows10 for the GoPiGo! Don't know what any of these languages are?  Don't worry, GoPiGo helps you learn the basic coding languages.
When we looked at how to make GoBox accessible and engaging for all skills levels, we decided that developing the missions for the GoPiGo in Scratch was the best option. 
Programming the GoPiGo in Scratch
Scratch is an easy drag and drop language developed at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) for teaching new programmers how to code. Rather than typical lines of code, you’ll use simple shapes and graphics to program your robot.
Why a monthly subscription? 
It’s the gift that keeps on giving. Your monthly GoBox comes with a new sensor for your robot to help you accomplish a mission. Each mission builds on the next, so you are learning new skills and staying engaged over a period of time -- which we believe is the key to success! 
What’s a Mission? 
What’s more exciting than going on a mission? Our team of illustrators, animators, teachers, engineers and designers are crafting beautiful and easy to understand materials that lead you through a story that helps you accomplish something cool with your GoPiGo and each new sensor. 
Check out this sample robot Mission, which not only teaches concepts about biomimicry but does so in a way that explains programming concepts like if and else statements, how robots read sensor data, concepts like thresholds, and math concepts like averages and how they apply to coding.
Click This Picture to View a Sample Mission (PDF)
Each Mission will be accompanied with helpful videos to get you started and walk you through certain parts of the Mission.
Engineering Concepts  
Each mission has fundamental engineering principles woven into the mission. The GoBox teaches new ways to think about how to approach and solve problems.
Each mission presents a problem and provides the tools to approach and solve the problem in your own unique way. Our missions encourage the design theory approach: state the problem, design, build, code, test, and iterate.
This allows students to find their own answers, and encourages them to come up with their own missions!
Programming Concepts: Making them real.
With GoBox, you’re not just playing with a robot, you’re actually learning programming concepts without it ever feeling like a computer science class. A robot makes the whole coding and programming experience tangible and real.
Some of the concepts that are taught in the 12 GoBox missions include: program structure, if then statements, forever until control structures, variables, loops, nesting loops, waits, sequencing, state machine, inputs and outputs, broadcasting, conditional statements, iteration, variables, random numbers, event handling, parallel execution, and boolean logic.  
Aren't sure of what all of these terms mean? No problem - that is exactly what GoBox is meant to help teach.
Not just a toy.…
Since GoPiGo can also be programmed in Python, Go, Node.js and a growing list of other languages supported by our community, when you or your child outgrows Scratch, a whole world of powerful programming languages awaits! Also, because the GoPiGo is open source, our active community is constantly adding new examples, languages, and features. 
Our Favorite Reward - GoBox - The Basic Package. 
The full package. You get the upgraded GoPiGo2 full robot kit delivered to your door before the Holidays. Then, over the next 11 months, we’ll send you a fun new mission for your robot to accomplish with a sensor. The missions are in a story form of step-by-step instructions that take you through the whole experience. You’ll have full access to our video library and support forums as well. The monthly sensors include the light sensor, sound sensor, ultrasonic sensor, buzzer, LED, motion sensor, button sensor, infrared sensor, and the brand new GoPiGo Line Follower.
Rewards
GoBox Hardware and Rewards
GoPiGo2 - the new and improved version of the GoPiGo! You’ll get the brand new version of the GoPiGo robot for the Raspberry Pi. The robot is easy to assemble and turns your Raspberry Pi into a robot car! (works with all versions of the Raspberry Pi)
Printed Missions - Each mission comes as a full color printed booklet. For those that already own a GoPiGo, these missions, the software, and the sensors will work with the older version of the GoPiGo as well as the GoPiGo2.
Additional Supplies - Each mission will come with additional supplies to help you add more functions to your GoPiGo in order to accomplish the missions.
GoPiGo Line Follower - The GoPiGo Line Follower sensor helps you program the GoPiGo to find and follow lines written on a surface.  
Camera - The Raspberry Pi camera is a 5 megapixel camera that connects directly to the Raspberry Pi on the GoPiGo. The camera can be used to take pictures, stream video, and track objects. 
Servo Kit - The Servo Kit mounts to the front of the GoPiGo, and enables things to rotate on the GoPiGo. You can connect an ultrasonic sensor, Raspberry Pi camera or other sensor to the servo to get it rotating independently from the GoPiGo.
Light Sensor - The light sensor detects different levels of light around the GoPiGo, and enables you to program the robot to react to those readings in whatever way you choose!
Sound Sensor - The sound sensor reads the level of noise around the GoPiGo and enables you to use that data to make the GoPiGo react to changes in noise.
Ultrasonic Sensor - The ultrasonic sensor tells how far the GoPiGo is from a solid object. It can be used to measure distance from a wall, person, or another object.
Buzzer - The buzzer adds sound and alerts to the GoPiGo. Make a sound with the GoPiGo to send alerts or scare your cats! 
LED - The LED adds lights to your GoPiGo. This LED can be attached to the GoPiGo to add a little personalization, help debug programs, and light up the room.
Motion Sensor - The motion sensor detects moving objects around the GoPiGo.
Button - Add a button to your GoPiGo. You can plug the button sensor into the GoPiGo to command the robot to move different ways, and do different things.
Infrared Sensor - Send commands to your GoPiGo with your TV remote or other infrared based remote controller.
Reward Tiers
The GoPiGo2 - Get just the robot. You already have a Pi.  GoPiGo2 is our latest version of the GoPiGo Raspberry Pi robot car. Easier to assemble, more durable, and more fun! 
Six Month Mission - If you already own a GoPiGo, you can test the waters with six months worth of missions (1/2 of the sensors).
Twelve Month Mission - If you already own a GoPiGo, you can get 12 robot missions -- with the full set of sensors. A GoBox will be delivered to your doorstep every month for a full year!
The Early Bird GoBox - Get the robot and all the missions! You'll get a box every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays!
The Six Month Mission + GoPiGo2 - If you want to test the waters with six months of missions and still need the GoPiGo. You'll get a box every month for half a year with a mission, a story, and a sensor. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays!
The GoBox USA - The GoBox - Get the robot kit and all the missions! You'll get a box every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays!
The GoBox International - The GoBox - Get the robot kit and all the missions! You'll get a box 4 times per year with a total of 12 missions and accompanying sensors. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays!
The GoBox Advanced - Get the robot kit and all the missions! You'll get a box every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays! You'll also get a Servo Package and a Camera giving your GoPiGo robotic vision!
The Custom GoBox - You'll get a GoBox every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you the new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays! You’ll also get a Servo Package and a Camera. You get to select a custom color for the acrylic body for your GoPiGo!
Twins (GoBox x 2) - Double your fun! Maybe you've got two kids or grandkids that would both love building a robot. You'll get two GoBoxes every month for a year with a mission, and a sensor. We'll ship you two new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays! 
Workshop/Classroom Pack (GoBox x 5) - You'll get five GoBoxes every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you five new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays! 
Meetup Pack (GoBox x 10) - You'll get 10 GoBoxes every month for a year with a mission and a sensor. We'll ship you 10 new GoPiGo2 in time for the Holidays! 
The Insider - See how the Pie is made! Not only do you get a 12 month GoBox, but we'll fly you from anywhere in the world to see how the GoBox and GoPiGo are made. You’ll arrive in Shenzhen, China where you will get a full factory tour, a visit to Huaqiangbei, the world’s premier electronics market, and we'll treat you to the best cuisine Southern China has to offer!  We'll throw in a free personal translator as well!
Custom GoBox Colors
Want a color other than clear?  If you choose the The Custom GoBox Backer Level, you will be able to choose the color for your GoPiGo2 robot body.  We will offer the following custom colors:  
Blue body.
Wooden body.
Purple Body
Neon Frame
Where we’ve been.  
When the Raspberry Pi first came out, we realized the power of this little $35 computer -- not only in getting people interested in technology, but learning about robotics! We saw the robot trapped inside each Raspberry Pi that we believe has mass appeal to all kinds of learners.
We tested the idea through a Kickstarter campaign for the GoPiGo 1, and were overwhelmed by the response. 
Since then, we have been doing everything we can to gather feedback and build a better robot that is easier and even more fun to use!
Fulfilling our Previous Kickstarter
We’ve shipped thousands of GoPiGos and received fantastic feedback from our engaged and creative community. We still weren’t getting where we wanted to be though: a robot that anyone, with any background, can use.
GoBox Testing with Parents
We wanted to make it even easier to get started with coding and robotics, so we assembled a team to make a system that could help anyone, with any background learn robotics. And, after redesigning our hardware, software, and now developing missions that pull it all together, we think we’ve done it -- GoBox!
For the past few months we’ve been designing, redesigning, and testing our new materials with groups of parent-child teams, and transforming our lessons into missions that teach robotics in a fun way.
Team
We’re devoted to robotics education. Our company has been around for five years, and we are passionate about designing and making robots that people enjoy using.
John - All around nice guy. When not answering questions on our forum or thinking up new robots, John is helping Karan keep our code fresh. John founded Dexter Industries.
Taryn - Customer experience wizard. Taryn has many hats at Dexter Industries, but the most important one is keeping customers happy and making sure we’re all learning.
Bridget - Bridget is an engineer, a teacher, and mom. She’s the fantastic writer that designed our missions, brought them to life, and even did some early testing with them on her own kids!
Karan - Code and Hardware Ninja. Karan is always either writing new code or helping others write their own. He’s constantly answering questions, improving the code for our projects, and making things better, easier, faster.
Drake - Illustrator extraordinaire. Drakes work speaks for itself: he designed all the beautiful pictures on this page! He is also our lead designer for the GoBox.
Amanda - Key Account Queen. Amanda makes sure we deliver on our promises by making sure every product makes it to the customer. She's managed our Kickstarter rewards before, so we got this.
Amber - Customer Success Angel. Amber is on the front lines listening to customers and helping them find what they need. She's a positive force of nature that gets us all organized and operating smoothly.
Our Community and Support
By far the biggest accomplishment with the GoPiGo has been establishing an open, supportive and growing community. Our inspiration, the source of our feedback, and our wellspring of ideas has been the Dexter Industries community. 
By backing our project, you become part of that community, and with it, get access to a wide breadth of knowledge and support that is shared on our forums, newsletters, Facebook, and Github.
We take immense pride in having three successful Kickstarters under our belt! We’re getting pretty good at figuring out the manufacturing side of a successful Kickstarter project, and making sure we deliver what we promise.
How we’re using backer contributions.
We’re developing curriculum. GoBox is a sequence of missions designed to take you step-by-step through your journey of learning programming and robotics. In order to do this well, we have illustrators, designers and artists, working alongside engineers and professional educators that have developed curriculums and learning programs for decades. Everyone on our team is passionate about developing the most effective and engaging program that’s out there!
Manufacturing robots!
We’re setting up the tooling, designing beautiful packaging, and building systems for testing the GoPiGo2, the Line Follower, and other sensors included in your GoBox.
How’d we come up with these goals?
Based on our past experience of what it takes to do these types of projects, we’ve set our goal at $30,000. We’ll be able to deliver a high quality program that will thrill any adult-child team. However, surpassing that goal will allow us to develop even cooler missions — so if you want to see how crazy things could get, share with your friends, family and school.
Timeline
Delivery by the Holidays!
Delivery by the Holiday Season! We’re committing to getting the first GoBox to our backers in time for the 2015 Holiday Season (latest delivery of Dec 20th).
Every month after...
What’s better than getting a robot for Christmas? Well, GoBox is even better because it’s the gift that keeps on giving — with a new mission and equipment delivered every month for the rest of the year!
Where we’re at right now...
As of our launch, we have the hardware and software designed and prototyped. We have a manufacturing plan in place as well as agreements setup with our suppliers. All that’s waiting on the hardware end is for us to give the signal!
GoPiGo Raspberry Pi Line Follower Prototype
We have the first few lessons written (see our example lesson here!), tested, and graphically illustrated. We’re working on the next eight, with most of the content developed. Over the next three months we will have these final lessons tested, iterated on, illustrated, and polished.
GoPiGo Robot
Share
Please share this with friends, family, and colleagues to help us bring this to life!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all hardware projects, the risk of delays is possible. We’ve spent the past five years building and shipping hardware. We have built manufacturing partnerships to help plan for and manage these risks.

That’s not to say there are things we haven’t seen! We’ve worked to secure our supply chain, run design-for-manufacturing tests, and set everything up to run smoothly. However, each time we start a new project, new challenges arise. We will handle these challenges with the same enthusiasm, honest communication, and diligence that we’ve handled challenges in the last three projects.

We’re abiding by the golden rule of hardware manufacturing: estimate conservatively!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A fully integrated personal, portable, and affordable golf sensor system, ClubHub allows golfers to:
See real-time data for every shot - on course or on the range 
Track shot distances and locations on course to deliver scoring stats and shot data
View 3D images of their swing to instantly analyze path and motion
Share swing and round data with an instructor or friends
See in-depth map views with GPS distances to any point on the hole 
Full Swing Analysis capturing swing speed, face angle, angle of attack, tempo, transition angle
Whether you’re looking to improve your game, build on a recent golf lesson with your instructor, or just have fun diagnosing your swing data and stats from your latest round, ClubHub lets you see your game in a whole new way!
SIMPLE SETUP
The sensor on each club works with an app to automatically analyze your swing and track your shots from tee to green on the range. To get started, just place the sensors into each of your clubs. After a quick, one-time pairing process, simply launch the app on your iPhone or iPad and you’ll be ready to play. 
 Accurate Swing Analysis
ClubHub delivers what no other club sensor can: real-time swing analysis data from the course or the driving range. Take a swing and instantly see your data on the app, including: 
Club Head Speed
Face Angle
Angle of Attack
Tempo
Transition Angle
AUTOMATIC SHOT TRACKING
ClubHub's GPS tracking technology allows you to record rounds and scoring stats that were previously available only to tour pros. The distances and accuracy of all your clubs are recorded, including your Driving Distances, Fairways Hit, Greens in Regulation, and Putts.
 ANALYZE YOUR DATA ANYTIME
All your swing and shot tracking data is stored and tracked in real-time in the ClubHub Cloud, so you can view it on the range and course with your mobile device and tablet or at home using your desktop web application.
Golfers - ClubHub makes it easy to review, analyze, and share your shot tracking and swing analysis data in real-time from a round either on course or during a practice session. Gain greater insight into your game by comparing your range session swings to the swings you make during a round, analyzing your stats and learning your tendencies. 
Instructors - Golf instructors now have the ability to analyze their student's game even when they're not with them. By viewing their student's data, instructors can see on course swing characteristics and course management skills to help students develop a better all-around game.
 Stretch Goals
Become a ClubHub Super Backer
 We are giving away three prizes to the 3 top Super Backers. 
 First Place 
Win a Full Set of ClubHubs (14 Sensors) 
 Second Place 
Win The Range Pack Plus (3 Sensors)
 Third Place 
Win the Range Pack (1 Sensor)
Want to win? Follow These Easy Steps: 
 1. Get your own custom ClubHub Super Backer Link below from our website. It will look like this one:
getclubhubgolf. com/JohnDoe
2. Share your ClubHub link and feel good knowing you are helping your friends improve their golf game! Share your link everywhere… on social media, email it to friends and family, share it with your golf buddies, etc.
3. Anyone you refer will be tracked on the ClubHub Super Backer Leaderboard (see it here). The pledge amount of every person you refer will be reflected on the leaderboard in dollars. For example, if someone clicks your link and they back the full set, the leaderboard will show $399.00 next to your name. If the next day another friend backs the Range Pack, the leaderboard will update to $448.00.
With a successful Kickstarter campaign, Kinetek Sports is expecting to begin manufacturing ClubHub in the fourth quarter of 2015. You can expect to receive your rewards late in 2015.
Kinetek Sports, the makers of ClubHub, is a sports technology company comprised of individuals with varied and complimentary backgrounds in science, technology, brand management, and sporting goods.
The Team has close ties to the game of golf on both a personal and professional level. Kinetek Sports was founded in 2009 on the principles of maximizing athletes' kinesthetic sense through technology. Simply put: We develop authentic performance products for athletes that are premium quality and fun to use. 
Mike Kurtz, John Melican, Taylor Linkenhelt, Pat Steusloff, Tom Lupfer, Diana Wiedenhoeft, Scott Carlson, and Ali Proehl are all dedicated members of the Kinetek Sports Team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
KINETEK SPORTS warrants this product to the original purchaser to be free from defects in material and workmanship, under normal use and conditions, for a period of one (1) year from the date of original purchase, pursuant to the following terms:

Company agrees, at its option during the warranty period, to repair any defect in material or workmanship or to furnish an equal product in exchange without charge, subject to verification of the defect or malfunction and proof of the date of purchase. However, insurance, handling, transportation, and other incidental charges in relation to repair work are borne by the original purchaser.

This warranty does not cover the following:
- Any product which has been subject to neglect, negligent care, improper use, accident, or used in violation of operating instructions;
- Any damage or defect caused by battery leaking;
- Any units altered, manipulated, disassembled, or repaired for warranty defects by anyone other than Company, including you and the retailer you may have purchased it from.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Do you know how far you really hit each club? Most amateur golfers overestimate their clubs distances and leave their shots short as a result. With GOLF TAGS you will know the exact distance of every shot, in real time. Plus you will gets detailed insights about your game, like prevailing misses, shot dispersion, playing strategy and much more.
But most importantly, GOLF TAGS let you stay focused on the game - tracking is done with a simple tap and quickly becomes part of pre-shot routine. So you can play better and enjoy the game more.
See your game like never before
Re-live your round on your phone or on the web
With GOLF TAGS you will see every shot on the map and get feedback about your game, in real time, out on the course.
Set up and start playing in minutes
Simply tap the phone before you hit the ball. Golf Pad app on the phone will record shot location and club choice.
Powered by the top-rated app
Golf Pad comes with GPS rangefinder, aerial maps and rich statistics
Golf Pad is loved by hundreds of thousands of golfers, and for a good reason. It's fast, easy and intuitive, yet loaded with features. Note, some features and advanced statistics require Golf Pad Premium upgrade that costs $9.99 per year. Each GOLF TAGS set includes an upgrade code good for one year, so that you can try them out. However upgrade is NOT required to track your game with GOLF TAGS - you can use GOLF TAGS with the free version of the app, forever.
Statistics tracked automatically
Club distances
Shot dispersion
Distance trends
Fairways hit or missed
Greens in regulation
Scoring analysis
Course strategy
Putting
Pick the right club, every time
Once you have played a couple rounds with GOLF TAGS, the app will be able make club suggestions for you using our sophisticated club recommendations algorithm. Club recommendations is under development now and will be complete in time for fulfillment.
Accuracy insights
See shot dispersion for every club. This includes both driving and approach shots. Know where you tend to miss and what part of the game you need to work on.
Works beautifully with smartwatches
GOLF TAGS are fully compatible with most popular smartwatches, including Android Wear, Pebble, Samsung Gear and Magellan Echo. See club confirmation and last shot’s distance whenever you scan a tag with your phone. And your watch works as a golf GPS the rest of the time.  
Conforms to tournament rules
Playing in a tournament? Great! You can still track your game with GOLF TAGS. Just use the Golf Pad Tournament Edition app (coming soon). The app will conform to tournament play rules when local Rule permitting distance measuring devices is in effect  (see USGA Decision 14-3/0.5). You will not see shot distances and club recommendations while playing, but full game analysis will be available after you finish the round. 
You can switch between the regular Golf Pad app and the Tournament Edition at any time.
Course strategy insights
See how you played each hole in the past and pick the strategy that works the best
Golf Pad shows your drives and approach shots on the map. Pars or better are shown in white, while bogeys or worse are shown in red. This way you can see what strategy works the best for you. You can also compare the performance and outcomes of using different clubs on the tee. In the end, you can make better decisions based on the real data from your own rounds.
Quick and easy setup
Simply screw a tag into the back of each club. 15 tags are included.
When you scan a tag with your phone for the first time, Golf Pad prompts you to select the club. Club pairings are saved under your account, so that you never need to repeat that step again.
Stretch goal - GOLF TAGS in BLACK
We are excited to announce that GOLF TAGS will be available in STEALTH BLACK if we can reach $50,000 in funding! Please rally your friends, shout out on social networks and let's make this happen! 
There is no separate reward for the black version. If the goal is met, all backers will have the option to select their preferred color at the end of the project. Note, the black version will ship 2-3 weeks later than the blue one. 
How does it work?
GOLF TAGS rely on Near Field Communication (NFC) technology. Each tag has a small, unique radio token inside. When you tap the tag to the phone, it records current location and club choice. Since it knows where each shot started and ended, it can compute every shot’s distance and statistics. You can see, edit and share the results in real time, right on your phone.
The tags inside are passive radios, so you never need to replace or recharge the batteries. 
System requirements and technical details
GOLF TAGS work on phones running Android 4.0 or higher equipped with NFC radio. Most modern phones have one, see the complete list here.
NFC radio is only active while the phone screen is on. So Golf Pad introduced the innovative 'SmartLock' mode. It keeps the screen on, reduces brightness to save energy, and blocks on-screen controls to prevent accidental inputs. More information about using SmartLock during the round is available here.
Continuous GPS and NFC usage increase battery drain. Most users can finish a 4 hour round with 25-50% of battery left. If you have an older phone or tend to run out of juice before the end of the day, we recommend turning off account sync and Wi-Fi while playing. And if you plan to play two rounds on the same day, be sure to bring a portable charger - you can get one under $20 on Amazon.
iPhone user? Unfortunately Golf Tags are only compatible with Android at this time. While iPhone 6 has NFC radio built-in, it is currently restricted to Apple Pay. The good news is you can still use the Golf Pad app on iPhone as a rangefinder and scorecard. We hope to be able to make Golf Tags available for the iPhone in the future.
Our team and story
Seattle team
Engineering team in Novosibirsk, Russia
Golf Pad started in 2011 with a golf app for Android and then expanded to iPhone. Over the years it became a top-rated choice for golfers, praised for ease of use, yet loaded with features. 
We were one of the pioneers of tee-to-green shot tracking. Our users loved the insights that gave them, but said it takes a lot of work to track every shot by pulling out and unlocking the phone. That's how we came up with GOLF TAGS.
At the PGA Merchandise Show in Orlando
We announced GOLF TAGS at the PGA Merchandise Show in Orlando, built the initial batch and used it to validate the design and functionality. We received tons of user feedback that helped us further improve the product. The first batch is almost sold out. 
Now we need your help to build the next iteration of the hardware and expand the software. The tags design is getting improved with slicker profile and extended holding surface. Packaging is greatly improved too. The money we raise on Kickstarter will be used to fund the new injection molds, scale the production, build the new packaging, and add more game analysis features within the app and on the web.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Golf Tags are nearly complete. We've had a chance to validate the product in various environments, on multiple Android devices, and in different countries. 

Supply Chain Risk
We partnered with CMF Industries, a well-established manufacturing company headquartered in Washington state to manage manufacturing and supply. CMF has over 25 years of experience manufacturing parts and products of various complexity, both domestically and in China. We expect a smooth ride. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.

Software Risk
Some of the features listed above are currently under development. This includes the intelligent club recommendations and the Tournament Edition of the Golf Pad app. We have many years of software expertise and we believe the features are on track for June delivery. However, unexpected delays may occur. If this happens we will communicate our progress and work on adding the features as quickly as possible while maintaining high quality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The wait is over! Black GOLF TAGS will be shipping to backers worldwide today. If you picked the black version of GOLF TAGS as a reward, you will be receiving a notification and a tracking number today or tomorrow.
Once you get your GOLF TAGS set, please follow the instructions on this page to get started: http://support.golfpadgps.com/support/solutions/articles/14479-setting-up-golf-tags. If you have any questions, please refer to http://support.golfpadgps.com. The site has instructions for submitting a support ticket in case your question is not answered.
Great news - the wait is almost over! The black version of GOLF TAGS is on the way to our fulfillment partner and will be ready to ship out to backers next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Black GOLF TAGS shipping next week!
updates.update_content:
Great news - blue GOLF TAGS are shipping to backers worldwide today! We partnered with Fulfillrite to manage rewards fulfillment. You will be receiving a notification and a tracking number soon if you did not receive one already.
So we made good on our goal to ship in July, even though we did not expect it to be such a close call :-) The lesson is things always take longer than originally planned with manufacturing and logistics.

Just a quick update on shipping. We received the blue version of GOLF TAGS from China and express-shipped them to our fulfillment vendor, FulfillRite. If all goes through as expected, they will be receiving the boxes tomorrow and will start shipping rewards to backers worldwide on Friday, July 31st. We are keeping our fingers crossed :-)
Golf Pad team.

Great news - the blue version of GOLF TAGS is built, packaged and is on the way to our warehouse space in Seattle! We are now finalizing the details of fulfillment process and will post another update as soon as we have the firm date when the rewards will be shipped out to the backers. Black GOLF TAGS are being manufactured now.
If you are a backer and you have not completed the survey yet, please please please complete it as soon as possible. We do need your address so that we can deliver the reward. If you completed the survey, but your address has changed since, please send us a message on Kickstarter and provide the new address.

updates.update_userinfo: GOLF TAGS are on the way to Seattle
updates.update_content:
Here’s a quick update to say a huge THANK YOU to all the Kickstarter backers for making GOLF TAGS a success. It’s been an amazing ride and we’ve enjoyed every minute.
While the Kickstarter campaign has ended, we are busy preparing for sending out the rewards. Here's what's going on right now:
Manufacturing is under way. We are on track for shipping in July!

Hello GOLF TAGS supporters! We are excited to announce several big news and updates:
Tags production is under way. We are on track for July deliveries as of now!
New reward added! We partnered with our good friends at Magellan to offer GOLF TAGS + Smartwatch bundle at a great price point. With Magellan Echo Fit smartwatch you will be able to see the confirmation of the club scanned as well as distance of the last shot immediately when you scan a tag. And the rest of the time the watch shows GPS distances to front, middle and back of the green as well as score details. Echo is not limited to just golf - you can use it for running, cycling and many other activities. One thing you can forget about though is charging: the battery lasts for months even with heavy usage. Note, this is the latest generation version that includes activity and sleep tracking. More details on the watch and compatibility at

Huge thanks to our supporters!! We reached our funding goal in incredible 3 days and the project is still going strong.
A few quick updates for our supporters base: 
We gave the green light to our manufacturing partner to get started on the production. Everything is on track for July delivery as of now. 
We are finalizing the details for the stretch goal. Stay tuned!
